Document Title: Research of Control Methods for Axial Field Flux-Switching Permanent Magnet Machine
Authors: X. Yuan; W. Z. School of Electrical Engineering; X. L. School of Computer Science; L. Hao; Y. Liang
Author Affiliations: Nantong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nantong, China; Nantong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nantong, China; Nantong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nantong, China; Nantong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nantong, China; Nantong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nantong, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A new type of 6/13-pole axial field flux-switching permanent magnet (AFFSPM) machine is proposed in this paper, which has the advantages of compact structure, large torque density, high efficiency and good fault tolerance. The topology structure of AFFSPM machine is analyzed and the mathematical model is derived in this paper, and then on basis of which, the vector control, direct torque control and model predictive torque control methods are applied for the drive system of the AFFSPM machine and studied by MATLAB/Simulink. The static and dynamic characteristics are compared and analyzed under the three control methods. The simulation results show that the model predictive torque control can make the control system of the AFFSPM machine get better static and dynamic operation performance.
Author Keywords: axial field flux-switching permanent magnet machine;vector control;direct torque control;model predictive torque control
IEEE Terms: Torque control;Mathematical model;Torque;Predictive models;Stators;Machine vector control;Permanent magnets

Document Title: Optimization and Mechanical Strength Analysis of Less-Rare-Earth Interior Permanent-Magnet Synchronous Machines Used for Electric Vehicles
Authors: W. Wang; Y. Liu; M. Wang; Z. Fu; P. Zheng
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, State Key Laboratory of Robotics and System, Harbin, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper investigates the optimization and mechanical strength analysis of the less-rare-earth interior permanent-magnet synchronous machines (LRE-IPMSMs) used for electric vehicles, which are characterized by high power density, high efficiency and low cost. Firstly, the structure parameters of the investigated LRE-IPMSM including the PM thickness and flux barrier location angle are optimized. Secondly, the stress distribution of the investigated LRE-IPMSM is analyzed as the investigated LRE-IPMSM has a high maximum speed. Then, the effects of the bridge shape and location on the maximum stress and electromagnetic torque are studied. Finally, the optimal LRE-IPMSM is proposed by taking various factors into consideration.

Document Title: The Influence of Stator Material on the Power Density and Iron Loss of a High-Performace Starter-Generator for More Electric Aircraft
Authors: D. Golovanov; Z. Xu; D. Gerada; M. Degano; G. Vakil; C. Gerada
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Nottingham, Nottingham, Nottingham, UK; Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Nottingham, Nottingham, Nottingham, UK; Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Nottingham, Nottingham, Nottingham, UK; Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Nottingham, Nottingham, Nottingham, UK; Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Nottingham, Nottingham, Nottingham, UK; Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Nottingham, Nottingham, Nottingham, UK
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Maximizing the power density as well as efficiency are two of the main critical aspects for engineers who are designing electrical machines for aerospace applications. Iron losses have a significant impact on the total machine efficiency, thermal state and, eventually, on the final machine design. This impact becomes especially critical for high-frequency machines. Thereby a selection of optimal stator material which allows minimizing the total weight and iron losses is very important. This paper focuses on the comparison of cobalt-iron alloy and high-grade non-oriented silicon steel materials in terms of influence on the starter-generator iron losses and power density. Analytical and finite element models are used for calculation and optimization of the machine parameters. The optimization of starter-generator design is performed by using genetic-algorithm taking into account thermal state and the estimation of passive mass. The results of investigation allows for the selection of an optimal stator material based on the machine efficiency, power density as well as the cost considerations.
Author Keywords: power density;high-speed electrical machine;Iron loss;soft magnetic materials

Authors: D. Ye; J. Li; R. Qu; H. Lu

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The dual three-phase machine drive system has been widely studied for its high power density and high reliability. The fault tolerance ability of the dual three-phase machine makes it suitable for the more electric aircraft (MEA). The MEA-used power system requires a low dc-link voltage ripple and torque ripple. This paper studies a high performance dual three-phase interior permanent magnet synchronous generator (IPMSG) drives for MEA. In addition, simulations have verified the performance. The dc-link voltage ripple is less than 0.2%.

Authors: A. Soualmi; F. Zidat; P. Lombard; N. Mokhtari

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The thermal behavior of electrical machines is a crucial step in design. To have a complete model it is necessary to compute and evaluate the temperature in different parts of the machines (winding, magnet, rotor and stator yoke). This study is achieved using finite element method (FEM), temperature distribution in two machines with different shape of magnets are considered in this study. This work is done in collaboration with PSA. This paper deals with thermal management aspects of electrical machines used in high performance applications with particular focus on electric machine designed for electric vehicles. The comparison is done for PM machines with V and I shape, the electromagnetic performances of these machines are already computed.

Document Title: Investigation of Electromagnetic Performance of Magnetic-Field Modulated Brushless Double-Rotor Electrical Variable Transmission for HEV s
Authors: J. Bai; J. Liu; R. Ma; W. Liu; P. Zheng; Y. Liu
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The magnetic-field modulated brushless double-rotor machine (MFM-BDRM), getting rid of brushes and slip rings, can be a promising candidate for the electrical-continuously variable transmission in hybrid electric vehicles HEVs. In traditional PM machine, the winding wingding parallel branches have not effects on the electromagnetic performance because each branch is the same in theory. However, owing to the MFM-BDRM is based on special operating principle-magnetic field modulating principle. Therefore, each branch of one phase is not symmetrical completely if the selection of winding wingding parallel branches is more than 1. Hence this paper mainly focuses on the influence of wingding parallel branches on the electromagnetic performance of the MFM-BDRM. Finally, the selection law of winding wingding parallel branches is provided for the MFM-BDRM.
Author Keywords: Brushless double-rotor machine;design;hybrid electric vehicles;harmonic back EMF;magnetic-field modulated;pole pair combination;wingding parallel branches;circulation current

Document Title: A Speed Sensorless Control of Induction Machine Based on Single DC Current Sensor
Authors: K. He; J. Li; R. Qu
Author Affiliations: School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering HUST, China; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering HUST, China; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering HUST, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposes a speed sensorless control of induction machine based on single DC current sensor. To estimate the rotor flux accurately and robustly to parameter, we adopt the adaptive full order observer with feedback matric. At the same time, to estimate the speed as quick as possible and less steady error, the paper design the adaptation mechanism based on the transfer function of the error equation. The current is vital to flux observer, and it is also the reference of the speed estimation. In order to improve the reliability of current detection and reduce the cost. we cancel the AC current sensors, replace them with a single DC current sensor to reconstruct the phase currents. However, the phase current is not always available if the voltage vector located where active voltage vector applied too short to sample the DC current sensor. We propose a method to reduce the unmeasurable area by shifting the carrier phase. the validity is verified by simulations.
Author Keywords: induction machine;speed sensorless;single DC current sensor;Adaptive full order observer

Document Title: Operating Strategy and Iron Loss Model of a Permanent Magnet Assisted Synchronous Reluctance Machine with a Ribless Rotor
Authors: M. Zimmermann; L. Schupp; B. Piepenbreier
Author Affiliations: Electrical Drives and Machines, University Erlangen-Nuremberg, Erlangen, Germany; Electrical Drives and Machines, University Erlangen-Nuremberg, Erlangen, Germany; Electrical Drives and Machines, University Erlangen-Nuremberg, Erlangen, Germany
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Permanent Magnet assisted Synchronous Reluctance Machines (PMaSynRM) received a growing interest in the past decade. They offer several advantages in comparison with other machine types, e.g.: Low rotor losses occur with respect to induction machines. The use of ferrite magnets avoids cost intensive rare-earth magnets in permanent magnet synchronous machines. The low power factor of a pure synchronous reluctance machine is increased. However, the PMaSynRM also causes iron losses which are difficult to determinate. This paper deals with the iron loss modeling as well as the choice of the current set points (operating strategy). The focus is on the analysis of the measurement results and the impact of the speed. The prototype includes a special ribless rotor which is characterized by low cross-coupling and a high magnetic anisotropy.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The power density of electrical machines required for transport applications has become a critical aspect. With most of the power loss in high power density electrical machines often being generated in the stator winding assembly, it is necessary to reduce these losses. Also, the effects of strands and bundle positions in the slot on the AC losses in the winding are often overlooked. This paper gives an analysis into such effects on an existing high - speed traction motor design with the aim of optimising the conductor layout in the slot for minimizing the total loss.

Document Title: Modeling and Estimation for Conducted Common-Mode Interference of a Motor Drive System Used in Electric Vehicle
Authors: D. Zhang; S. Zhang; T. Fan; X. Wen
Author Affiliations: Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Motor drive system in an electric vehicle (EV) connects both low voltage (LV) bus and high voltage (HV) bus. Since the vehicle's communication, lighting, instrumentation and vehicle control system, etc. are all powered by LV power supply, the interference level at the low voltage power port of the motor drive system has a significant influence on the operation of EV. This paper studies the interference coupling mechanism between the HV and LV circuit in an EV motor drive system, establishes the interference equivalent circuit to estimate the common mode conduction interference level on the LV power supply port. This research lays a foundation to attenuate the emission of conducted interference from motor drive system to the LV power supply system of EV.

Authors: P. Wirasanti; W. Srirattanawichaikul; S. Premrudeepreechacham
Author Affiliations: Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Chiang-Mai University, Chiang-Mai, Thailand; Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Chiang-Mai University, Chiang-Mai, Thailand; Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Chiang-Mai University, Chiang-Mai, Thailand
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The estimation of battery state of charge and remained battery life are crucial for battery management along driving cycle of electric vehicle. There are plenty researches based on both topics. Nevertheless, most of the researches are based on the study of battery cell, and the calculation methodologies are complex. To overcome both mentioned issues and find simple estimation method for electric vehicle, this paper is focused on the study of battery package and the lightweight methodology. The Peukert method and the Palmgren-Miner method are proposed for battery state of charge and battery life estimation, respectively. Both methods are implemented and tested with the real scenario-based battery electric bus operation.

Document Title: Simulation of Self-Driven Evaporative Cooling System in Large Capacity Permanent Magnet Machine
Authors: X. Bin; F. Yun; L. Guohui
Author Affiliations: Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Self-driven Evaporative Cooling System has many advantages to cool the stator of large capacity permanent magnet machine. The two-phase flow distribution of self-driven evaporative cooling system in the cooling channel does directly affect the cooling efficiency of stator. This paper introduces the simulation method of two-phase flow for self-driven evaporative cooling system, analyses the structure of stator cooling system and two-phase flow channel in the stator. The special two-phase flow CFD simulation model is built and the simulation gives the velocity and volume fraction distributions in the cooling channel, which are the basis for evaluation of cooling capacity. In order to analyze the influence of different influential factors on the distribution of flow field, a variety of simulations are carried out under different conditions, and the results are compared.

Document Title: Prediction of Transient Parameters of PM Synchronous Machines Based on Hilbert-Huang Transform
Authors: S. Guo; J. Song; S. Zhang
Author Affiliations: State Grid Hunan Electric Power Company Limited, Research Institute, Power System Technology Center, Changsha, China; State Grid Hunan Electric Power Company Limited, Dispatching Control Center, Changsha, China; Bangor College, Central South University of Forestry and Technology, Changsha, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The permanent magnet synchronous machines (PMSMs) have been used in a variety of different industrial applications. The transient parameters of the PMSM determine the safe operation and stability of the whole system. This paper introduces Hilbert-Huang transform (HHT) to identify the transient parameters of the PMSM. First of all, based on three-phase sudden short-circuit current, the DC and AC components from the transient current are extracted by using empirical mode decomposition (EMD). Then, by performing curve fitting on the envelope of DC and AC components separately, the transient parameters of the PMSM are obtained. Finally, the current waveform based on identification parameters is compared with the finite element (FE) current waveform to verify the effectiveness of the identification method.

Document Title: Optimization of Coils for Wireless Power Transfer System in Electric Vehicle
Authors: J. Liu; Z. Wang; M. Cheng
Author Affiliations: Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, a pair of circular coils for wireless power transfer system in electric vehicle is optimized and implemented. The coils are designed with finite element method. Several parameters such as external diameter, turns, distance between outer and inner coil, existence of ferrite and shield plates are studied and optimized for their effects on coupling coefficient and mutual inductance, which are key factors to improve the efficiency. A 3-kW prototype is implemented. The experimental results verify that efficiency of the system from input DC side to output DC side is 93.53 % with a 150mm gap between two coils at 85-kHz operating frequency.

Document Title: Experiment Analysis on Motor-Generator Pair System for Providing Inertia of Renewable Energy
Authors: Y. Zhou; G. Xu; Y. Huang
Author Affiliations: North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, Beijing, China; North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, Beijing, China; North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: With the increasing of the penetration of renewable energy in power system, the whole inertia of the power system is declining, which will endanger the frequency stability of the power system. The motor-generator pair (MGP) system can deal with these problems efficiently. In this paper, the basic working principle of MGP system is introduced firstly. Then the theoretical basis of source-grid phase control method is proposed. The frequency response of PV system with/without MGP system is compared by experiment. The results show that the MGP system can provide inertia support for renewable energy, which can increase frequency stability for renewable energy power grid.

Document Title: Torque Analysis of Magnetic-Field-Modulated Double-Rotor Machines with Virtual Work Method
Authors: J. Liu; J. Bai; P. Zheng; S. Zhang; M. Wang; Z. Yin
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The magnetic-field-modulated brushless double-rotor machine (MFM-BDRM) is a new power-split device for hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs). A simple and intuitive torque calculation model for the MFM-BDRM is proposed to estimate the torques of the MFM-BDRM rapidly and investigate the torque characteristics of the MFM-BDRM directly. The structure and the working principle of the MFM-BDRM are first introduced. Then, the torque expressions of the PM rotor, the modulating ring rotor and the stator are deduced based on virtual work method. The deduced torque expressions show the effects of the machine parameters on the electromagnetic torque of the MFM-BDRM clearly. Comparisons between analytical calculations and finite element calculations are carried out. The analytical results are in good agreement with the finite element results, verifying the accuracy of this model.
Author Keywords: brushless double-rotor machine;magnetic-field-modulated;torque analysis;virtual work method

Document Title: Influence of Machine Parameters and Cooling Method on the Overload Capability of Permanent Magnet Synchronous Machines
Authors: F. Birnkammer; D. Gerling
Author Affiliations: Chair of Electrical Drives and Actuators, Universität der Bundeswehr München, Neubiberg, Germany; Chair of Electrical Drives and Actuators, Universität der Bundeswehr München, Neubiberg, Germany
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The starting point in the design of electrical machines usually is the assumption of a maximum allowed current density in the winding or a related quantity prescribed by a certain cooling method. This way, the desired nominal operation without overheating of the winding is ensured based on empirical values. In dynamic applications on the other hand, where nominal power and above is only demanded seldom, this means an unnecessary thermal reserve. By including the overload capacity in the early design stage, this potential can be exploited and allows for the design of small and lightweight machines still able to fulfill the demanded loads. The overload capability is thereby defined by thermal boundary conditions. For optimal use of the thermal potential in the machine design, extensive knowledge of the thermal system and its influence on the overload capacity is mandatory. Against this background, this paper focuses on the investigation of the thermal overload capability of an interior permanent magnet synchronous machine, also with respect to the applied cooling method.
Author Keywords: component;formatting;style;styling;insert

Document Title: Effect of Control in Electrical Drives on Image Registration Supporting Motion State Estimation
Authors: H. Li; F. De Belie
Author Affiliations: Metals, Mechanical Constructions & Systems of Ghent University, dept. Electrical Energy; Metals, Mechanical Constructions & Systems of Ghent University, dept. Electrical Energy
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In modern electrical drives, more and more smart algorithms are used to support the control. One of those algorithms is image registration, allowing, in a graphical way, to estimate the motion states from an image, registered from multiple samples of the phase currents and its time gradients. By searching for deformations in these images, such methods allow to take into account physical nonlinear phenomena such as magnetic cross-saturation, known to affect the motion state estimation of the rotor. In this paper, the image registration is illustrated on a DTC drive for a salient pole synchronous machine and the effect of control on the distribution of current sample points within the image is studied.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Electrical Steel is of paramount importance as the Electric Vehicle (EV) traction motors. Thin-gage Non-Grain Oriented (NGO) silicon steel has been increasingly popular in high-speed and large-torque Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motor (PMSM) since low-loss electrical steels were recently discovered. This paper mainly presents that the performance and characteristics of EV electric motors using varieties of thickness under different frequencies. At first, electro- magnetic and mechanical properties of single-sheet and iron core of electrical steel will be described. Secondly, algorithm and numerical model of iron loss model will be explained. Finally, the modeling and experimental results are shown and analyzed among different thickness and before and after Stress Relief Annealing (SRA).

Authors: T. Kim; G. Won; Y. Chung

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper focuses on shipboard power systems that consist of electric propulsion and multiple diesel generators. To reliably supply the electric power to the loads in the shipboard power system, there have been strict regulations defined for design and operation of power generation systems. This paper proposes a novel method for optimal power dispatch and unit commitment algorithms for shipboard power systems specifically using dynamic programming algorithm. The proposed algorithm considers the minimum fuel consumption as well as the reliability requirement. To this end, we derive the cost functions of diesel generators based on Specific Fuel Consumption (SFC) obtained by manufacturer's experimental tests. The performance of the proposed methods is verified via simulation studies on various seasonal ship operation conditions based on statistical analysis of measurement data. Simulation results clearly demonstrate the effectiveness of these proposed methods.

Abstract: In this paper, a consequent pole structure is presented to reduce the volume and number of permanent magnets (PMs) in comparison with a benchmark machine. Magnet torque decreases with the volume of PMs. However, the consequent pole structure can generate reluctance torque. Abstract: Taking 12-slot/10-pole interior permanent magnet synchronous machines (IPMSMs) with fractional-slot concentrated winding (FSCW) as the study subject, this paper aims to investigate the issue of the power factor and explore the feasible improvement measures. The effect of phase angle and amplitude of stator current on power factor (PF) is studied in detail under the condition of the given rotating speed. Different phase angle of stator current corresponds to different operation state, which is related to control strategies. With increase of inner power factor angle ψ(I<sub>s</sub>,E<sub>0</sub>) ranging from -10 degree to 90 degree, PF increases first and then decreases. PF declines with the amplitude of stator current increasing for the specified control strategies. In addition, the average electromagnetic torque increases with increasing the stator current for different inner power factor angle ψ(I<sub>s</sub>,E<sub>0</sub>).

Abstract: In this paper, a nonlinear fractional-order analysis model is presented to investigate the chaotic behavior of the single-machine infinite-bus power system with electromagnetic power disturbance of synchronous generator. The minimum order for chaotic oscillation occurring in the system can be found by using this model. The influence of the parameters, such as the frequency ratio and the disturbance amplitude of electromagnetic power, on the system chaotic behavior may be revealed as well. Based on this analysis model and the stability theory for power system, an active feedback controller can be designed for the synchronization control of the drive and response systems. The analysis model is used for the study of an example power system. Numerical simulation is carried out to validate the model and the effectiveness of the controller.

Abstract: This paper proposes a novel vernier machine which could offer higher torque density compared with the regular permanent magnets (PM) vernier machine. The proposed machine has two stators and one rotor sandwiched between the two stators. The three-phase winding is placed in the outer stator slots and Halbach array PMs are placed in the slot openings. Both inner stator and rotor have consequent pole structure with PMs. Each of the three kinds of PMs can produce working harmonic magnetic field, and then induce back electromotive force (EMF) in the windings with the same frequency and phase angle. The back EMF can be hugely enhanced due to the trinal magnetic modulation effects, which lead to a higher electromagnetic torque. After optimizing the Halbach array PMs, width of inner stator PMs and width of rotor PMs, the machine can produce a higher torque and torque ripple is lower. The electromagnetic torque is 22% larger than regular surface mounted PM vernier machine.

Abstract: Iron sleepers which are laid under the long stator of the ironless permanent magnet linear synchronous machine (IPMLSM) to support it are critical parts to the whole maglev system. It is important to analyze the iron sleepers' effect on the force characteristics of IPMLSM and to reduce this effect by decreasing the bias amount of power angle characteristics and the force fluctuation. In this paper, the model of the IPMLSM is built up based on the finite element method (FEM), and different structure parameters of the iron sleepers are researched to find out the relation between structure parameters and the effect caused by iron sleepers. This paper also analyzes the way to reduce this effect. As the iron sleepers are important in the construction of maglev system, especially the experimental line, and may bring inevitable problems, the simulation results about iron sleepers could provide a guidance for the construction of maglev experimental line.

Abstract: The subdomain technique has been widely used to predict electromagnetic performance in permanent-magnet (PM) machines. Due to the high accuracy of magnetic field distribution prediction by subdomain technique, a simple method for electromagnetic performance calculation in surface-mounted PM machines with skewing is proposed. By taking the machine with step-skewed magnets as a combination of multi-machines operating with different rotor positions at the same instant, the influence of the axial magnet segments can be considered in 2D subdomain model of surface-mounted PM machines. Abstract: This paper investigates influences on impedance characteristics for magnetic saturations of main and leakage fluxes. The demonstrated impedance characteristics will promote effective use of sensor-less vector control systems of an induction machine (IM) with high frequency voltage signal injections. The IM is driven with an ideal voltage source, and the impedances are evaluated in operation at no-load and various load conditions. The impedances for high frequency components are measured from the amplitude ratios of high frequency voltage to the current, and their high frequency components are extracted using Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) analysis. As a result, the main flux saturation saliencies are obtained under the conditions of high frequency and high voltage levels, and the leakage flux saturation saliencies are obtained under the conditions of high frequency and low voltage levels. In addition, the locus of the leakage flux saturation position change under various load conditions are clarified.

Abstract: A novel 6/13-pole hybrid excitation axial field flux-switching permanent magnet machine (HEAFFSPMM) has the advantage of strong fault-tolerance ability, high efficiency and large torque density. In the paper, the fault tolerances of 6/13 HEAFFSPM machine and the conventional 12/10 AFFSPM machine are compared and analyzed under the condition of short-circuit fault. It is found that 6/13 HEAFFSPMM can effectively restrain the turn-to-turn short-circuit current and the other normal phase currents in contrast with 12/10 AFFSPMM under the fault-tolerant control of SVPWM based on the principle of the constant magnetomotive force (CMMF). In order to improve the fault-tolerant performance, the minimum copper loss fault-tolerant control method is proposed in this paper, and the related experiments are done to validate the control method.

Abstract: This paper focuses on the study of torque model for permanent magnet synchronous machines (PMSMs). In order to investigate the accuracy of the model, the previous and improved models are studied on a fractional slot concentrated winding (FSCW) 20-pole/24-slot and a distributed winding (DW) 20-pole/60-slot inset-SPM machines by finite element method (FEM). The two kinds of machines are analyzed on stator MMFs and inductances to study the differences between them. Furthermore the linear, nonlinear and zero-consequence problems are investigated. Abstract: In this paper, an improved dynamic model of squirrel cage induction machines (IMs) is presented using the magnetic reluctance network (MRN) approach. Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The long stator linear synchronous motor (LSLSM) for high-speed maglev vehicle is used not only for propulsion but also for suspension system. The performance of propulsion control will be affected by the suspension system. Therefore, this paper presents a novel propulsion control scheme to reduce the thrust fluctuations caused by the influence of the suspension system. The control scheme is proposed based on the estimation of mutual flux linkage between the excitation winding and the d -axis stator winding of the LSLSM. By adding the flux linkage information to the outer speed loop and the inner current loop, the thrust fluctuations caused by the suspension system will be effectively suppressed. The simulation results show the effectiveness of the control scheme.

Authors: Q. Li; T. Fan; Y. Li; X. Wen
Author Affiliations: Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this work, a surface-mounted permanent magnet (SPM) machine with negative salient pole is proposed, to improve the electromagnetic characteristics without increasing magnet usage and processing difficulty. To achieve negative salient pole, several notches are added into the q-axis flux path in the proposed SPM machine, the q-axis inductance decreases, while the back electromotive force (EMF) is almost not affected. Hence the armature reaction magnetic field under q-axis current excitation is weakened, as well as the saturation of stator core. Therefore the output torque is enhanced by the negative salient pole, while the core losses and magnet eddy-current losses are suppressed. Both the torque improvement and losses reduction are validated by finite element analysis (FEA) results, compared with the conventional SPM machine.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Sensorless operation based on third harmonic back-EMF has the advantage over the fundamental back-EMF such as free of pulse width modulation (PWM) noise and less influenced by variation of parameters of machine. In order to achieve instantaneous rotor position and speed, a phase-locked loop (PLL) is always proposed, in which third harmonic back-EMF and its integration taken as the input signal. However, direct integration may result in integral drift and saturation. To avoid such circumstance and achieve high-resolution position, an improved PLL structure is introduced in this paper. It is found that the error between estimated and actual position caused by integral drift is decreased compared with conventional PLL ways. In addition, experiments based on improved PLL structure is implemented in this paper to verify the feasibility of such kind of method.

Abstract: This paper first introduced a high power density series hybrid power system based on microturbine and Li-ion batteries. This paper proposes a hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) simulation platform to eliminate risks and costs related to the testing and validation of the system components. The test target of the ECU is mainly concerned with the function realization of the system operation mode switching. Abstract: The paper presents a motor design of permanent magnet synchronous motor (PMSM)used for electric aircraft propeller drive. The goal of motor design is to meet high power density and high efficiency simultaneously. First, in order to improve the power density of the PMSM, the influence of the pole and slot combination, the groove structure of different sizes and the new ferromagnetic materials on the performance of the motor is studied. Secondly, the electromagnetic properties and loss characteristics of the new ferromagnetic materials are systematically analyzed and calculated using an accurate core loss calculation model. Third, through the analysis of the temperature and electromagnetic coupling field, the equivalent thermal network model of the motor is established, and the temperature distribution of the rated load and overload of the motor is obtained. Finally, the motor efficiency map of torque - speed is calculated to determine whether it meets the research objective.

Abstract: This paper presents an offline control optimization parameters approach to improve performance of switched reluctance generator (SRG) at medium and low speeds in electric vehicles (EVs). Considering the requirements of the EVs which are the riding comfort, the efficiency of energy recovery, and the life of battery, three indicators-minimum torque ripple, maximum power output, and minimum current ripple-are selected as optimized objectives. The multi-objective function for optimization with weight coefficients is proposed. Then, the optimization controller of SRG is designed based on parameters of variable turn-on and turn-off angle. Finally, through contrast and analysis of the output power optimization controller, the feasibility of the multi-objective optimal control strategy is proved in this paper. The results show that the optimization controller meets the requirement of enhancing riding comfort of EVs, improving efficiency of energy recovery, and increasing the life of battery.

In this load dispatching, battery outputs average component in an averaging time, while EDLC outputs fluctuation component. The Averaging Time is decided based on the sum of the section time and standard deviation for overall driving cycle. This paper deals with three famous driving cycles, JC08-mode, UDDS and NYCC. In addition, actual driving patterns (measured by author) are used to estimate the battery degradation level by using dynamic degradation model for the battery. To compare the economy, cycle cost is introduced. Simulation results indicate that the proposed method improves the degradation level and reduce the cycle cost.

The magnetic field, inductances, mechanical characteristics, external characteristics and short circuit fault performances of the two motors have been compared in details. When a new in-wheel motor is manufactured, the experiments can be done finitely. How to get the thermal performance parameters of the motor quickly is very important for the accurate evaluation of the performance. In this paper, a number of simple experiments are established. Document Title: Single Halbach Field Magnet Desined from Dual Halbach Field Magnet for Rotating Machines
Authors: N. Morimura; H. Suzuki; M. Morishita
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Kogakuin University, Tokyo, Japan; EOLUS Company Limited, Yokohama, Japan; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Kogakuin University, Tokyo, Japan
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A coreless synchronous motor with a dual Halbach field magnet (DHFM) has been developed. A cylindrical DHFM equally converted from paralleled dual Halbach array of Permanent magnets (PMs) with the square cross section. The magnetic flux density distribution generated by the DHFM contains little space harmonics. The DHFM gives superior features such as little torque ripple and non-cogging torque to the high-speed rotating machines. However, it was difficult to cool the armature coil at high torque output. This paper proposes a single Halbach field magnet (SHFM) to solve this problem. The SHFM is constructed by replacing the outer part of the DHFM from the gap center with a ferromagnetic material. The SHFM gives better cooling performance to the coreless synchronous motor. The paper reports the test results of a 10 kW 10,000 rpm motor prototype for load and speed. Results were obtained with a total efficiency of 91% at continuous rated operation and a coil temperature of 60°C. The prototype testing proved that the SHFM can give superior features to high-speed rotating machines.

Abstract: Fractional-slot concentrated-windings interior permanent magnet synchronous machines (IPMSMs) have been gaining interest over the last few years, especially in high-speed traction application. This is because the advantages such as high power density, high efficiency, short end turns, low cogging toque, good flux weakening capability and so on. However, these machines usually exhibit high amount of sub-harmonic spatial fields, which will lead to high rotor eddy loss and low efficiency. In this paper, a tangential structure fractional-slot IPMSM with segmented magnets and multi-layer winding is proposed to reduce the sub-harmonics in magnetic field. Finite element (FE) method is used to calculate and analyze harmonic fields. Results show that the tangential rotor structure can reduce armature MMF sub-harmonics and eddy current loss obviously.

Abstract: The speed of the Magnetic suspension compressor is very important for the control of the entire compressor. In general, no additional speed sensor is arranged in the compressor. During the operation of the compressor, the speed of the motor can be estimated by designing an observer for the motor current, voltage and other signals. However, when the motor idles in inertia during shutdown, the current of the motor cannot be obtained by the observer. This article introduces a speed identification method based on phase-locked loop in the idle state of the motor, which can accurately obtain the rotational speed of the motor in the idle state, and provides a solid guarantee for the unbalance compensation of the magnetic bearing in the whole process. The bearings can be stopped in time when the machine stops, making the shutdown process more intelligent.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, the characteristics of duty-cycle control method and current control method are compared in PV system under the same maximum power point tracking (MPPT) mode condition and verified by simulation and experiment. MPPT algorithm is based on perturb and observe (P&O) algorithm which has advantages of fast response, simple implementation and controllable availability. As a precondition for the performance comparison between duty-cycle control and current control method, the variable width of the PV voltage is designed to maintain the same value during one cycle of MPPT mode by setting variation of duty reference corresponding to variation of current reference through a series of processes. To verify the performance of two methods, simulations and experiments are performed to compare voltage, current and captured energy in PV PCS system. Under 1.7kW maximum power point condition, two control methods are verified in the same value of instantaneous power and instantaneous power integration through simulation and experiment in one cycle of MPPT. The operating point of two methods is located in the same point. The instantaneous power integration value is 3.26[kWs] for duty-cycle control and 3.22[kWs] for current control in experimental results.

Document Title: Large Signal Stability Analysis of AC Microgrids Considering the Storage System
Authors: X. Liu; Z. Gao; Y. Bian
Author Affiliations: North China University of Technology, China; North China University of Technology, China; North China University of Technology, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Many urban communities are increasingly turning to AC Microgrids (AC MGs) as an alternative source of electricity. Distributed energy sources, different loads, and energy storage systems are all interfaced with AC MGs through power electronic converters. These tightly regulated loads could be regarded as constant power loads (CPLs), usually inducing negative impedance instability problems. Unfortunately, most stability studies have been based on small signal linearization techniques. This paper investigates the large signal stability of AC MGs based on mixed potential theory, and considers the influences of the storage system and CPLs. Firstly, the AC MGs are converted to DC systems in dq rotating frame. Then the mixed potential models are constructed and analyzed, and large signal stability criteria are derived. The criteria give important constraints on control parameters of the storage system, and the characteristics of CPLs are also taken into account. Simulation results indicate the criteria could guarantee the whole AC system stable during large disturbances.

Abstract: In this paper, a sensorless voltage-oriented vector control strategy is proposed for direct voltage control (DVC) of the stand-alone brushless doubly-fed induction generator (BDFIG). This control strategy can achieve the control for the amplitude and frequency of the power winding (PW) voltage, without any speed sensors based on the PW stator-flux model reference adaptive system (MRAS) structure for observing the rotor speed of the employed generator. In order to verify the effectiveness of the proposed control strategy, some of the obtained simulation results are introduced. The simulation results indicate that the PW amplitude voltage and frequency are kept constant under rotor speed and load variations. Furthermore, the results verify that the estimated rotor speed tracks the reference value at steady state with a good transient response which ensures the effectiveness of the proposed sensorless control method based MRAS observer for DVC of standalone BDFIG for ship shaft applications.

Abstract: The electrolytic capacitor is the key component that not only lowers the reliability of single-phase to three-phase power converter for drive system, but also makes high current harmonics at the AC grid. Recently, the drive system with a film capacitor has been researched for its long lifetime and the characteristics of small volume and low cost. However, the input power factor is reduced and the AC input current waveform is distorted when the motor is driven at light load conditions. In order to deal with this problems, the direct input power control method that related to the AC input voltage and current is proposed in this paper. Furthermore, in order to keep the dc-link voltage higher than the inverter output line-to-line voltage, the flux-weakening control that varies synchronously with the double frequency of the AC input voltage is adopted. The results verified the correctness and effectiveness of the proposed method.

Authors: S. Sun; K. Yang; F. Jiang; H. Zhang; L. Tang
Author Affiliations: Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wuhan, R.P.China; Science and Technology Research Institute, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Shenzhen Huazhong University, Shenzhen, R.P.China; Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wuhan, R.P.China; Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wuhan, R.P.China; Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wuhan, R.P.China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, a novel axial-radial flux permanent magnet machine is analyzed. T-type stator core, salient pole rotor, and squirrel-cage-type PM rotor are proposed in this machine. The T-type SMC stator core provides axial-radial flux path with specially designed twisted-winding. The salient pole rotor is part of the radial flux path, providing asynchronous torque and synchronous reluctance torque. The squirrel-cage-type PM rotor is part of the axial flux path, providing synchronous torque and asynchronous starting torque. 3D finite element model is built and simulation work proceeds. No-load, full-load, magnetic field distribution, etc. are analyzed. A prototype is fabricated to verify the idea.
Author Keywords: axial-radial flux;PM machine;SMC;FEM
INSPEC Controlled Terms: magnetic fields;magnetic flux;permanent magnet motors;rotors;squirrel cage motors;stators;torque
INSPEC Non-Controlled Terms: T-type stator core;axial-radial flux permanent magnet machine;squirrel-cage-type PM rotor;axial-radial flux path;T-type SMC stator core;salient pole rotor

Document Title: A Hybrid Control Method of 3-Level NPC Using PI and Predictive Current Control for Bipolar LVDC System
Authors: K. Kang; J. Kang; J. Song; H. Lee; C. Won
Author Affiliations: Electrical and Computer Engineering, Sungkyunkwan University, Suwon, Republic of Korea; Electrical and Computer Engineering, Sungkyunkwan University, Suwon, Republic of Korea; Electrical and Computer Engineering, Sungkyunkwan University, Suwon, Republic of Korea; Electrical and Computer Engineering, Sungkyunkwan University, Suwon, Republic of Korea; Information and Communication Engineering, Sungkyunkwan University, Suwon, Republic of Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In recent years, research on bipolar LVDC(Low Voltage DC distribution) systems has been actively proceeding due to the increased interest in renewable energy. In this paper, discrete time modeling is performed to apply model predictive current control(MPCC) to 3-level NPC AC/DC PCS(Power Conversion System) with LCL filter, which is mainly used in bipolar LVDC systems. In order to improve steady-state stability and transient state dynamics of 3-level NPC AC/DC PCS and top and bottom capacitor voltage balancing control, we proposed an algorithm which combined application of conventional PI current control(PICC) and model predictive current control(MPCC). The control performance of the proposed algorithm is verified by PSIM simulation.
Author Keywords: Bipolar LVDC;3-Level NPC;Model Predictive Control;PI Control

Authors: M. Zhou; R. Zhang; Y. Du; Q. Ge; Z. Li

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, single current regulator flux-weakening control based on the d-q current cross-coupling effect for permanent magnet linear synchronous motor (PMLSM) is improved and a stable control process is implemented. When the speed exceeds a certain value, the control strategy is switched from the conventional double closed-loop control method to the flux-weakening control method. The method of taking the average value of multi-point sampling is used for mode switching judgment. And the improved switching method of the control mode achieves a stable switching process.

Document Title: Fault-Tolerant Control of Open-Circuit Fault for Permanent Magnet Starter/Generator
Authors: J. Huang; Z. Zhang; W. Jiang
Author Affiliations: Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Center for More-Electric-Aircraft Power Systems, Nanjing, China; Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Center for More-Electric-Aircraft Power Systems, Nanjing, China; Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Center for More-Electric-Aircraft Power Systems, Nanjing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper focuses on the fault-tolerant control of open-circuit fault that includes power switch fault and armature winding fault for permanent magnet starter/generator (PMS/G) system. A redundant leg is applied to the three-phase converter to substitute the faulted leg when open-circuit fault occurs in the power switches, while there is an fault in the armature winding, the neutral point of the PMS/G is connected to the middle point of the redundant leg to produce a path for zero sequence current, and a current compensating method is proposed in the vector control strategy to maintain the magnetomotive force (MMF). This method can ensure the stability of the output torque and the DC-link voltage when open-circuit fault occurs. The system performance is almost unchanged with power switch fault, and the output power will be reduced with armature winding fault. Simulation results show that the proposed topology and fault-tolerant control method are feasible for PMS/G system.
Author Keywords: armature winding;open-circuit fault;power switch;redundant leg
IEEE Terms: Circuit faults;Windings;Legged locomotion;Switches;Fault tolerance;Fault tolerant systems

Author Affiliations: Institute of Electrical Engineering in Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Institute of Electrical Engineering in Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The Double Motors Drive System (DMDS) is wildly used in production or scientific research areas., and the coordinated control problem of DMDS is the crucial factor determining its development and application. Based on two new control strategies., this paper focused on the torque balance control problem of DMDS, comparatively analyzed the control effects of traditional PI control algorithm and adaptive VSSMC algorithm. Finally., Experiment and simulation results demonstrated that the adaptive VSSMC algorithm could help the system achieve better tracking performance.

Document Title: Design of Rotor with Novel Barrier for Power Improvement of Spoke-Type Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motor
Authors: J. S. Yoo; H. Jang; S. Cho; G. S. Lee; S. Ko; S. Bae; H. Lee; H. Liu; J. Lee; H. So
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Hanyang University, Seoul, Republic of Korea; Department of Electrical Engineering, Hanyang University, Seoul, Republic of Korea; Department of Electrical Engineering, Hanyang University, Seoul, Republic of Korea; Department of Electrical Engineering, Hanyang University, Seoul, Republic of Korea; Department of Electrical Engineering, Hanyang University, Seoul, Republic of Korea; Department of Electrical Engineering, Hanyang University, Seoul, Republic of Korea; Department of Electric Automatization, Busan Institute of Science and Technology, Busan, Rebublic of Korea; Department of Electrical Engineering, Hanyang University, Seoul, Republic of Korea; Department of Electrical Engineering, Hanyang University, Seoul, Republic of Korea; Department of Electrical Engineering, Hanyang University, Seoul, Republic of Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This study investigated that A novel barrier was applied to improve the power of spoke-type PMSM for washing machine. The Novel barrier maximizes the power by minimizing the magnetic flux leakage generated in the outer and inner ribs. Magnetic flux leakage is a factor that lowers the power, and it is necessary to minimize the leakage magnetic flux. In addition, the design considering rotor stiffness was applied and the mechanical analysis was carried out. The Novel barriers are designed as a trapezoidal barrier and a circle barrier. The trapezoidal barrier is to minimize the magnetic flux leakage generated in the inner rib. Circle barrier is to minimize magnetic flux leakage generated in outer rib. After applying novel barrier, the power was improved and the safety factor was secured through the mechanical analysis.
Author Keywords: Spoke-type;PMSM;flux magnetic leakage;Power improvement;Rotor shape;Ferrite permanent magnet;Barrier

Document Title: Inductance Calculation for the Symmetrical Non-Salient Dual Three-Phase PMSM Based on Winding Function Approach
Authors: Z. Liang; D. Liang; S. Jia
Author Affiliations: Xi'an Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Xi'an, China; Xi'an Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Xi'an, China; Xi'an Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Xi'an, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Dual three-phase permanent magnet synchronous machines (PMSMs) are widely used in the applications which require high power density and high reliability. Inductance calculation for these dual three-phase windings of this machine type is a key issue for further performance analysis and controller design. This paper attempt to use the winding function approach to establish an analytical model for computing the inductance of the dual three-phase PMSM type with symmetrical winding configuration. With this method, a complete analytical expression of self and mutual inductances between phases has been obtained. Finally, simulation and experimental results have been implemented to verify the accuracy of calculation results.

Document Title: Research on Modeling and Simulation of Aircraft Cabin Pressure Regulating System Based on Stepper Motor Servo System
Authors: S. Zhou; L. Wang
Author Affiliations: School of Automation, Northwestern Polytechnical University, Xi'an, China; School of Automation, Northwestern Polytechnical University, Xi'an, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Cabin pressure regulating system is an important part of aircraft environmental control system, it is the equipment to overcome the adverse effects of environment on human and equipment when the aircraft is flying at high altitude, and ensure the safe and reliable operation of aircraft. A stepper motor is an actuator that transforms electrical pulses into angular displacement. The angular displacement can be controlled by controlling the number of pulses, so as to achieve the purpose of accurate positioning. Based on the characteristics of the stepper motor, it is applied to the aircraft cabin pressure regulating system here. The adjustment of the aircraft cabin pressure is achieved by changing the opening degree of the valve. The opening degree of the valve is controlled by the motor in the cabin pressure control system, so that when the air pressure outside is changed, and the actual pressure in the cabin can be changed according to the pressure value specified by the pressure system. The simulation results verify the validity and feasibility of the stepper servo system applied to the aircraft cabin pressure regulating system.
Author Keywords: Stepper motor;Environmental Control System(ECS);Opening degree
INSPEC Controlled Terms: aircraft control;avionics;machine control;position control;pressure control;servomechanisms;stepping motors;valves

Document Title: Sensorless Control for PMSM Connected with LC Filter Based on Extended State Observer
Authors: M. Wang; Y. Xu; J. Zou
Author Affiliations: Harbin Institute of Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin, China; Harbin Institute of Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin, China; Harbin Institute of Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In power electrical control systems, pulse width modulation (PWM) technique is always used. Nevertheless, it perhaps result in some unwanted effects, such as high insulation stresses, bearing currents and unexpected loss, etc. Therefore, in some industrial applications, LC filter is equipped on the output of the inverter to deal with side effects of PWM waves. It is noticed that the mathematical model of LC filter is not considered in conventional speed sensorless control methods of PMSM. If sensorless control of PMSM with LC filter is required, estimation methods considering the filter are necessary. In this paper, a sensorless control method is proposed for PMSM equipped with LC filter. An extended state observer (ESO) considering LC filter is proposed to estimate the back electromotive forces (BEMFs), and a phase locked loop (PLL) is utilized to estimate the electrical speed and rotor position. The effectiveness is demonstrated by simulation and experimental results.
Author Keywords: extended state observer;LC filter;PMSM;sensorless control
IEEE Terms: Sensorless control;Observers;Passive filters;Inverters;Pulse width modulation;Phase locked loops;Power harmonic filters

Document Title: High-Power-Factor Control of IPMSM Drive System with Small DC-Link Capacitor
Authors: C. Lu; W. Zhang
Author Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; College of Electrical Engineering Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposed a control strategy of interior permanent synchronous motor (IPMSM) which is fed by single-phase diode rectifier with a small DC-link capacitor. To obtain the unit power factor, the inverter current tracking strategy is applied in the system. Because of the fluctuation of inverter current in this system, a repetitive controller is attached to the inverter current loop to reduce the steady-state error. A method based on the “average voltage margin” is adopted in the d-axis current control, and a bus voltage PI controller is added to d-axis current generator to suppress the voltage spikes on the DC-link. The performance of the IPMSM drive system which used the proposed control strategy was tested through Simulink. The results indicate that the system could realize the effective control of motor speed and inverter current, and the input power factor of the system could achieve 0.97.
Author Keywords: High power factor;Small DC-link capacitor;Single phase diode rectifier;repetitive controller

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Monitoring the health of large synchronous Machines is now an integral part of their operation. The stator inter-turn short circuit fault is one of the serious fault and have a deep influence on the safety and effectiveness of the machine. This paper describes an online monitoring method with no sensor required to predict these two faults of synchronous condenser before they propagate to a level that can leading to catastrophic failure. The paper develops an analytical model for the online fault predicting by only knowing the stator and field current, and the detailed 2D FEA models will also be built to take the core saturation and leakage magnetic field into consideration. Finally, the method will be validated by experimental results.

Document Title: A Novel Electrical Model of Dielectric Barrier Discharge for Quasi-Homogeneous Mode and Filamentary Mode
Authors: Q. Zhang; H. Zhao; H. Lin; J. Wu
Author Affiliations: School of Automation, Northwestern Polytechnical University, Xi'an, China; School of Automation, Northwestern Polytechnical University, Xi'an, China; School of Automation, Northwestern Polytechnical University, Xi'an, China; School of Automation, Northwestern Polytechnical University, Xi'an, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The paper focuses on a novel electrical model of dielectric barrier discharge (DBD) considering both quasi-homogeneous mode and filamentary mode. The proposed model employs the partial discharging fractions to describe the difference between the ideal homogeneous discharge and the quasi-homogeneous discharge, and a RC circuit commutated by an ideal switch to simulate the filamentary discharge. Calculations of several electric parameters are given. Evolutions of conduction discharge current and gap voltage are given. Comparison of simulation results with experiment results is discussed, showing that the proposed model has an accurate and effective performance.

Document Title: Sensorless Position Detection Framework for a Multi-State Switched Reluctance Actuator of a Textile Machine
Authors: X. Liu; P. Germano; Y. Civet; Y. Perriard
Author Affiliations: École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), Integrated Actuators Laboratory (LAI), Neuchâtel, Switzerland; École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), Integrated Actuators Laboratory (LAI), Neuchâtel, Switzerland; École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), Integrated Actuators Laboratory (LAI), Neuchâtel, Switzerland; École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), Integrated Actuators Laboratory (LAI), Neuchâtel, Switzerland
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Sensorless needle position detection for the actuator of a textile machine is challenging because of its multi current levels used and the transient state when the current changes. A local regression method can be used to represent the variation of inductance via the measurement of the current through the actuator while the keys pass the selection area of the actuator. By calculating its correlation with a mother function, the position of the needle can be obtained. A Kalman filter is added at the end to compensate discretisation errors. The experimental results with different working speed have validated the proposed sensorless detection method.

Document Title: A Study on Induction Motor Efficiency Improvement for Implementing in Electric Vehicle
Authors: P. Lumyong; P. Sarikprueck
Author Affiliations: Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical Engineering, King Mongkut's Institute of Technology Ladkrabang, Bangkok, Thailand; Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical Engineering, King Mongkut's Institute of Technology Ladkrabang, Bangkok, Thailand
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Among various types of electric motor, selecting an induction motor for electric vehicle (EV) is still being discussed. Efficiency and weight of induction motor are two significant disadvantages compared to other motors. To solve these two concerns, this paper proposes a study to effectively improve induction motor efficiency and its power density. The stator winding of proposed three phase induction motor is rewound by decreasing number of turn and by increasing stator coil size. This proposed motor is suitable for EV driven by inverter in high speed operation which the rated power of this motor is approximately two times more than that of its original. As the results, the motor efficiency is improved since its total loss is slightly increased. In addition, as an increasing twice of rated motor power approximately with the same motor weight, the power density of the proposed motor is also enhanced. Three sizes of three-phase inductor motor including 0.75, 2.25, and 3.7 kW are tested to illustrate the proposed approach in this study.
Author Keywords: Three-phase induction motor;Motor efficiency improvement;EV motor;Rewound motor

Abstract: With the rapid development of the Chinese highspeed railway (CRH), How to describe the traction and energy consumption characteristics for the Electric Motor Train Units (EMU s) accurately becomes emphasis and nodus. In this paper, we optimized the logical control strategy in real typical operating conditions, then the muti-partical homogeneous rod model for the type of CRH<sub>2</sub>MEUs had been built up to realize the continuous traction calculation and analysis of energy consumption characteristics. Simulation and calculation results show that the designed model has a more accurate characterization and more reference value for the MEUs optimization such as railway line design, train operation, energy saving, etc.

Document Title: A Novel Modular 18-Slot 10-Pole PMSM with 9-Phase Unequal-Coil-Pitch Fractional-Slot Winding
Authors: K. Wang; H. Lin; H. Yang
Author Affiliations: Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposes a novel modular 18-slot 10-pole permanent magnet synchronous machine (PMSM) with 9-phase unequal-coil-pitch fractional-slot winding (UCP-FSW). The proposed machine allows stator to be modularized while significantly reducing rotor loss, which usually plagues the PMSMs with the conventional fractional-slot concentrated windings (FSCWs). Moreover, it also exhibits the merits of low cogging torque, low torque ripple and easy manufacturing. The structure of the proposal and the winding factor of the working harmonic are described and computed in detail. In addition, the main electromagnetic characteristics of the proposed machine are analyzed by finite element method (FEM) and compared with those of its 15-slot 10-pole counterpart equipped with the conventional FSCW.

Document Title: A Novel Model Predictive Current Control Method for Open-Winding PMSG Fed by Dual Inverter
Authors: X. Zhang; Y. Li; Y. He
Author Affiliations: North China University of Technology, Inverter Technologies Engineering Research Center of Beijing, Beijing, China; Collaborative Innovation Center of Key Power Energy-Saving Technologies in Beijing, Beijing, China; Collaborative Innovation Center of Electric Vehicles in Beijing, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: To solve zero-sequence current problem of open-winding PMSG control system with a common dc bus, a novel model predictive current control (MPCC) method is proposed based on the analysis of the working principle of the OW-PMSG fed by dual inverter. Compared with conventional MPCC method of the open-winding PMSG control system, the proposed method can reduce the computation burden of the voltage vector from 19 to 5. Simultaneously, the steady-state performance can also be improved. Finally, simulation results validate the effectiveness of the proposed method.
Author Keywords: Open-winding permanent magnet synchronous generator (OW-PMSG);zero-sequence current;common dc bus;model predictive control

Document Title: Magnetization of NdFeB Permanent Magnet Considering Demagnetization Effect
Authors: P. Sarikprueck; P. Lumyong; C. N. Niroiana; C. Attaphong
Author Affiliations: Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical Engineering, King Mongkut's Institute of Technology Ladkrabang, Bangkok, Thailand; Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical Engineering, King Mongkut's Institute of Technology Ladkrabang, Bangkok, Thailand; Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical Engineering, King Mongkut's Institute of Technology Ladkrabang, Bangkok, Thailand; Chulalongkorn University, Department of Civil Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Center of Excellence on Harzardous Substance Management (HSM), King Mongkut's Institute of Technology Ladkrabang, Research Program of Industrial Waste Management Policies and Practices, Bangkok, Thailand
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Electrical machine efficiency improvement has been paid more attention over the past years. Using Permanent Magnets (PMs) in various modern electrical machines is one of the most favorable approaches to increase machine efficiency. However, PMs still have a significant disadvantage that is the demagnetization issue. Therefore, these demagnetized PMs need to magnetize for regaining their initial capability considering the demagnetization level. Therefore, first of all, this paper proposes the demagnetization behavior of NdFeB PMs due to thermal effect. Then, these PMs are magnetized using a proposed simple magnetizing technique considering various demagnetization conditions. Finally, the results indicate that the most complete demagnetized PMs are able to significantly recover to their initial capability.
Author Keywords: Permanent magnet material;NdFeB;Magnetization;Demagnetization

Document Title: Rotor Position Detection Method at Zero or Low Speed for Electrically Excited Synchronous Motor
Authors: J. Kou; Q. Gao; K. Xu; S. Chen; D. Xu
Author Affiliations: Harbin Institute of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Harbin, China; Harbin Institute of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Harbin, China; Harbin Institute of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Harbin, China; Harbin Institute of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Harbin, China; Harbin Institute of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Harbin, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A sensorless rotor position detection method at zero or low speed based on field current harmonic for load commutated inverter (LCI) fed electrically excited synchronous motor is proposed in this paper. The field current harmonic is used instead of the extra high frequency signal injection. A reasonable harmonic frequency is selected, and a realizable field current control method is given. A LCI-fed electrically excited synchronous motor model is established, and the demonstration of this approach is provided through the simulation results by Matlab which verifies the feasibility and accuracy of the proposed detection method.

Document Title: Optimization of Photovoltaic MPPT System Efficiency Based on Combined Algorithm
Authors: N. Wang; M. Jin; Z. Wang; M. Cheng
Author Affiliations: Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, 210096, China; Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, 210096, China; Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, 210096, China; Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, 210096, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In order to realize the Maximum Power Point Tracking (MPPT) of photovoltaic system efficiently, an improved method of perturb and observe based on fuzzy logic control is proposed in this paper. A cost function describing the system efficiency is constructed and embedded into the proposed algorithm where the reference voltage can be obtained. Consequently, the optimal duty ratio can be achieved by PI regulation. Therefore, more accurate and efficient MPPT performance will be acquired. Simulation results are shown to validate the effectiveness of the proposed method.

Abstract: In this paper, we describe research on operation in Multi-Loop in the power distribution system. Therefore, the authors studied a search method that reduces the number of calculations and predicts optimal interconnection.

Document Title: Comparative Study of IPT Multi-Transmitter Coils Single-Receiver Coil System Focusing on Misalignment Tolerance and System Efficiency
Authors: S. Nutwong; A. Sangswang; S. Naetiladdanon; E. Mujjalinvimut
Author Affiliations: King Mongkut's University of Technology Thonburi, Department of Electrical Engineering, Bangkok, Thailand; King Mongkut's University of Technology Thonburi, Department of Electrical Engineering, Bangkok, Thailand; King Mongkut's University of Technology Thonburi, Department of Electrical Engineering, Bangkok, Thailand; King Mongkut's University of Technology Thonburi, Department of Electrical Engineering, Bangkok, Thailand
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper presents a comparative study of different structures of multi-transmitter coils single-receiver coil system, used in the inductive power transfer (IPT) applications. The aim is to compare the misalignment tolerance and system efficiency. Three different structures of multi-transmitter coils are simulated using a finite element analysis (FEA) software, to compare the magnetic flux density. Then, it is experimentally verified through magnetic coupling coefficient between coupled coils, at different horizontal misalignment from 0 to 5 cm. The measured system efficiency of three structures, at the same horizontal misalignment and output power of 10W are also provided.

Abstract: Load change is more frequent in satellites these days. In order to decrease the influence caused by sudden load change, this paper proposed a power balanced based predictive control method for satellite power systems. It uses the power balance algorithm to predict current and improve the dynamic response ability of the main bus. Validity of the proposed control method is verified by simulation results.
