Authors: Y. Huang; H. Wang
Author Affiliations: Institute of Electrical Engineering in Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Institute of Electrical Engineering in Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The Double Motors Drive System (DMDS) is wildly used in production or scientific research areas, and the coordinated control problem of DMDS is the crucial factor determining its development and application. Based on two new control strategies, this paper focused on the torque balance control problem of DMDS, comparatively analyzed the control effects of traditional PI control algorithm and exponential reaching law Variable Structure Sliding Mode Control (VSSMC) algorithm. Finally, Experiment and simulation results demonstrated that the exponential reaching law VSSMC algorithm could help the system achieve better tracking performance.

Document Title: A New Dead-Beat Predictive Current Control for IPMSM Drives with Single-Phase to Three-Phase Non-Electrolytic Capacitor Converter
Authors: Y. Zhang; L. Huang; J. Liu; X. Zhang
Author Affiliations: North China University of Technology, Inverter Technologies Engineering Research Center of Beijing, Beijing, China; North China University of Technology, Inverter Technologies Engineering Research Center of Beijing, Beijing, China; North China University of Technology, Inverter Technologies Engineering Research Center of Beijing, Beijing, China; North China University of Technology, Inverter Technologies Engineering Research Center of Beijing, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In order to reduce the cost and the size of a single-phase to three-phase converter, single-phase inverter without electrolytic capacitor was proposed. This paper proposes a novel control strategy for IPMSM drive system in the field of home air conditioners with single-phase to three-phase non-electrolytic capacitor converter. In order to quickly track the reference current and increase the power factor, in this paper dead-beat predictive current control (DBCC) is adopted, so the complicated current loop control is not required. However, due to the fluctuation of dc-link voltage and insufficient voltage margin, using conventional DBCC more harmonics exist on the grid-side current and dc-link voltage. Therefore, in order to further improve the performance and reduce the harmonics of the grid side current, an improved dead-beat predictive current control is proposed on the basis of the traditional method. Both simulation and experimental results are presented to validate the effectiveness of the proposed method.

Abstract: This paper describes a larger torque production capability of the independent multi-phase inverter-fed electric motor drive. The proposed motor can control the flux waveform in each stator tooth in spite of full-pitch distributed winding. Target of this research is to realize larger torque production by direct controlling interlinkage flux including harmonic components. This paper confirms the effectiveness of the proposed method by FEA and compares the simulation result of the proposed method and the conventional sinusoidal current excitation method.

Document Title: Control Design of Stand-Alone Brushless Doubly-Fed Induction Generator for Supplying Nonlinear Loads
Authors: O. M. Elbabo Mohammed; W. Xu; Y. Liu; K. Yu
Author Affiliations: School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, China; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, China; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, China; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposes a control method for standalone operation of the brushless doubly-fed induction generator (BDFIG) under nonlinear loads. The nonlinear loads could lead to distorted power winding (PW) voltage, which mainly contains fifth and seventh harmonics. The fifth and seventh harmonics can be eliminated by adding harmonics compensation loop to the machine side converter (MSC). And, the control winding current is regulated by proportional-integral-resonant (PIR) controllers. The effectiveness of the proposed control method is validated by both the simulation and experimental results.

Abstract: In this paper, Auto-tuning method of the controller for static excitation system of the generator with a low time constant is proposed. In order to optimally tune the controller in excitation system, the delay component of moving root-mean-square is equivalently modeled along with the static excitation system. Also, inaccuracy of estimated generator parameters is reduced by compensating fluctuation of acquired field current. The modified auto-tune method is verified through simulations.

Document Title: Optimal Study of Resonant Wireless Charging Coils for Electric Vehicles
Authors: Y. Dong; W. Lu; Y. Liu; H. Chen
Author Affiliations: Jiangnan University, School of Internet of Things Engineering, Key Laboratory of Advance Process Control for Light Industry (Ministry of Education), Wuxi, 214122, China; Jiangnan University, School of Internet of Things Engineering, Key Laboratory of Advance Process Control for Light Industry (Ministry of Education), Wuxi, 214122, China; Jiangnan University, School of Internet of Things Engineering, Key Laboratory of Advance Process Control for Light Industry (Ministry of Education), Wuxi, 214122, China; Jiangnan University, School of Mechanical Engineering, Jiangsu Key Laboratory of Advanced Food Manufacturing Equipment and technology, Wuxi, 214122, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In order to optimize the coil design of electric vehicle (EV) high power resonant wireless power transfer (WPT) system and improve its transfer efficiency, an equivalent circuit model of two-coil series-series topology is analyzed in this paper. Four optimal factors that affect the system transfer efficiency are proposed, i.e. the number of coil turns, the mean radius of coils, the transfer distance and the load. Based on the consideration of the equivalent series resistance of the coils, it can be found that the number of coil turns, the mean coil radius, and the load have the optimal values for the optimal transfer efficiency, while the shorter the transfer distance is, the higher the transfer efficiency is. By using the simulation software COMSOL, similar relationships between four factors and the transfer efficiency can be achieved with the calculation results. Moreover, by repeating the calculation using the simulation coil resistance, the differences between the calculation results and the simulation results are explained. Therefore, the WPT coil optimal method with proposed four optimal factors is verified through calculation and simulation.
Author Keywords: high power;resonant;wireless power transfer;coil optimization;equivalent series resistance

Authors: F. Zhang; L. Shi; Z. Yin
Author Affiliations: Chinese Academy of Sciences, Key Laboratory of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Institute of Electrical Engineering, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Key Laboratory of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Institute of Electrical Engineering, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Key Laboratory of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Institute of Electrical Engineering, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A novel efficiency optimization strategy based on optimal equivalent load in inductively coupled power transfer (ICPT) system is proposed to enhance system efficiency. The relationship between the load and the efficiency of ICPT systems with parallel multi-pickups is analyzed. An optimal load resistance is obtained with parameters of contactless transformer at which the efficiency is the highest. BOOST circuit is introduced to transfer the load into near optimal resistance region. A prototype has been constructed and the experiment has been carried out to verify the proposed strategy. The experimental results show the improved efficiency under light load.

Abstract: We consider a wound-field synchronous machine, with an electromagnet on its salient rotor, as an alternative to a permanent magnet in the rotor. We then examine the power performance characteristics, loss characteristics, V-curves and large short-circuit ratios for a large-scale turbine generator, considering the leading and lagging operations, based on the finite-element method. Authors: J. Yan; L. Ruan
Author Affiliations: The Institute of Electrical Engineering of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Laboratory of New Technology for Power Equipment, Beijing, China; The Institute of Electrical Engineering of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Laboratory of New Technology for Power Equipment, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: With the development of evaporative cooling system, the system structure becomes more and more complicated. In many applications, the evaporative cooling system for generator stator may incline at an angle. For natural circulation involving phase transition, especially in the inclined system, the stability is very important for optimal design and safe operation. So in this paper, taking the evaporative system for wind power generator as an example, the static instability is studied using nonlinear analysis theory, and then based on that the heat transfer limit of the cooling system was studied. Finally the method to estimate the maximum heat transfer capacity was got.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposes the control strategies for an electrical variable transmission (EVT) based dual power flow wind energy conversion system (DPF-WECS), which is configured with a back-to-back current source converter (CSC). The mathematical model of the CSC based DPF-WECS is derived and the corresponding control strategies for the outer rotor and inner rotor are given. The space vector pulse width modulation (SVPWM) is adopted for the CSC converter. The simulation model of the DPF-WECS is built in Matlab/Simulink and the simulation results verify the effectiveness of the proposed control strategies.

Document Title: Sensorless Control Technique of PMSM Based on RLS On-Line Parameter Identification
Authors: P. Sun; Q. Ge; B. Zhang; X. Wang
Author Affiliations: Chinese Academy of Sciences, Key Laboratory of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Beijing, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Key Laboratory of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Beijing, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Key Laboratory of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Beijing, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Key Laboratory of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A sensorless control strategy based on extended electromotive force (EEMF) combined with the on-line parameter identification for permanent magnet synchronous motor (PMSM) is proposed in this paper. Based on the mathematical model of PMSM, the EEMF observer is designed. The phase-lock loop (PLL) technique is used to detect the rotor angular speed and position. In order to eliminate the effect of variations in motor parameters on the accuracy of the sensorless algorithm, the recursive least square (RLS) algorithm is adapted for PMSM parameter identification. Then, the results of the parameter identification are used for sensorless control algorithm. The simulation model is built in Simulink. The results demonstrate that the proposed control strategy is effective.

Document Title: A Novel Method of Vibration Suppression in Position Servo Systems
Authors: C. Wang; J. Liu; L. Pei; L. Li; C. Zhong; C. Wang
Author Affiliations: Harbin Institute of Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin, Heilongjiang Province, China; Harbin Institute of Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin, Heilongjiang Province, China; Harbin Institute of Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin, Heilongjiang Province, China; Harbin Institute of Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin, Heilongjiang Province, China; Gree Electric Appliances, Equipment Dynamics Institute, Zhuhai, Guangdong Province, China; Gree Electric Appliances, Equipment Dynamics Institute, Zhuhai, Guangdong Province, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A novel control scheme is presented to eliminate the vibration in the position loop of the servo system. First of all, the mathematical model of the servo system is built, and the mechanism of the vibration is analyzed. Secondly, a notch filter is designed to suppress the positioning resonance, in which the resonance frequency, the bandwidth and the attenuation of the notch are fully analyzed. Thirdly, a controller based on modified active disturbance rejection control (ADRC) is proposed to reduce the phase lag introduced in the position controller. The extended state observer (ESO) of the active disturbance rejection control is linearized to reduce the computation load and to simplify the model. Finally, simulations and experiments are carried out, which indicated that the proposed method has better resonance suppression performance and faster response than traditional methods.
Author Keywords: vibration suppression;two-inertia position servo system;notch filter;active disturbance rejection control

Abstract: Permanent magnet linear synchronous motor (PMLSM) is a nonlinear, strongly coupled high order system. It is susceptible to uncertain factors such as internal parameters change, external load disturbance and so on. In view of this problem, an improved backstepping controller(BSC) is proposed in this paper. According to the Lyapunov stability theory, appropriate Lyapunov function and intermediate virtual control quantity are defined to realize the ideal tracking of speed of PMLSM. Experiment results validate that the backstepping controller can achieve fast response and stable tracking of speed. Compared with the traditional PI controller, the overshoot decreases obviously, and the dynamic and static characteristics are better.
Author Keywords: backstepping control (BSC);PMLSM

Authors: J. Jiang; M. Wang; R. Yang; L. Li
Author Affiliations: Harbin Institute of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin, China; Harbin Institute of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin, China; Harbin Institute of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin, China; Harbin Institute of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Siding mode control is a kind of nonlinear variable structure control. The chattering problem is the main problem that influence the smooth running of system. To reduce the chattering problem and keep the stability of sliding mode control at the same time, an improved boundary layer control is proposed in this paper. The error of reference velocity and real velocity is selected to make up the sliding plane. And the gain of the saturation function is variable to speed up the tracking speed of velocity and reduce the chattering problem when speed error is small. And a load thrust observer is proposed in this paper to observe the thrust ripple for feedforward compensation. Experiment results show that the improved boundary layer control can realize faster velocity tracking speed and also suppress the intrinsic chattering of sliding mode control.

Abstract: The 3-Level Modulation Method has been widely studied since the topology is mature and easy to apply to the industrial field. 3-Level three-phase half-bridge inverter has been widely used in the high-voltage and middle-voltage level to reduce the device stress, which is also suit for the application of the high-speed motor driver system due to the small electric parameter and the critical device stress. The space vector pulse width modulation (SVPWM) has been widely studied in both 2-L and 3-L topology. However, the implementation procedures differ significantly since the number of the space vector vary considerably. In this paper, a novel 3-L SVPWM modulation method is introduced which is based on the traditional 2-L SVPWM modulation method. Therefore, the algorithm changed slightly and only a renovation of the IGBT driver circuit should been done, which is quite easy to achieve. The method is verified by both simulation and experiment. The result reveal that the proposed method is easy to apply and could reduce the current harmonic of the winding of the high-speed PMSM.

Abstract: In high power traction drive system, the switching frequency is low due to the limitation of switching loss and heat dissipation. To improve the performance of the control system, this paper introduce a new multi-mode PWM scheme for Locomotive traction. Asynchronous SVPWM, synchronous SVPWM, SHEPWM and square wave modulation are adopted in whole speed region, respectively. The advantage of this strategy is that it not only reduced the harmonics but also achieved smooth transition between different modulation schemes. Abstract: This study presents a design and development of PI controller based maximum power point tracking (MPPT) techniques for solar charge controller using DC to DC BUCK converter. The MPPT solar charge controller in this research consists of solar panel, DC to DC BUCK converter, MPPT solar charge controller, battery and resistance load. Abstract: Doubly salient electromagnetic generator (DSEG) is a new type of generator and excitation current of it is crucial during the power generation. In order to enable DSEG to fault-tolerant operation when excitation fault occurs and excitation current is lost, the excitation fault of DSEG is studied and a fault-tolerant control strategy based on H-bridge converter is proposed for the excitation fault of DSEG. This paper firstly introduces the DSEG power generation system and its basic operating principle, then the excitation fault of DSEG is analyzed and the fault-tolerant operating principle of DSEG under the condition of losing excitation current is introduced. At last, the fault-tolerant control strategy of DSEG under excitation fault is given. Simulation and experiment results validate the correctness of the proposed method.

Abstract: This paper presents a virtual d-q frame-based power control strategy of a cycloconverter-type high frequency link converter for vehicle-to-grid applications in single-phase power systems. It is difficult to achieve sufficient performance for conventional power control methods based on stationary frames due to the nonlinearity of ac signals. The proposed algorithm divides the power component into active and reactive power components using the virtual d-q transform technique and independently controlling the two components in the linear region. Compared to the conventional method, the proposed power control allows the usage of simple proportional-integral controllers for achieving zero steady-state error for the fundamental components. As a result, satisfactory dynamics and steady-state responses in P-Q controls are guaranteed even under limited-bandwidth compensators. The effects of the proposed power control are verified by MATLAB simulation.

Abstract: A line-commutated converter (LCC) high-voltage direct current (HVDC) transmission system without AC harmonic filters for offshore wind farms has been proposed. In the system, power compensators are used instead of the conventional AC harmonic filters and static var compensators (SVC) to supply active and reactive power and to eliminate harmonic distortions. In this paper, steady-state characteristics of the LCC-HVDC transmission system for offshore wind farms are investigated. A simulation model of the system is first derived. The steady-state characteristics of the system are calculated with the simulation model and experimental studies were carried out to confirm the validity of the simulation model. It is shown that the output reactive power of the system with the proposed power compensator can be controlled independently. Finally, the operating range of the system is discussed through experimental and theoretical investigations.

In view of the fact that most ADRC strategies are used in single loop control of current loop or velocity loop, a dual loop ADRC controller based on parameter identification is proposed in this paper. The parameters of stator resistance, stator inductance and moment of inertia are identified online by using MRAS and Landau iteration algorithm, and the dynamic compensation of ADRC is carried out in real time. This strategy can deal with the problem of sudden change and stability decline caused by sudden disturbance and parameter change.

Abstract: The free-piston linear generator can be employed as an auxiliary power unit in the hybrid electric vehicles due to the advantages of high efficiency and multi-fuel flexibility. This paper proposes a novel double-sided flat-type permanent magnet synchronous linear electric machine which is one of the key components of the free-piston linear generator. The flat-type mover is equipped with quasi-Halbach permanent magnet arrays on its double surfaces, and is sandwiched between two flat-type stators. Concentrated windings are inserted in the slots of the stators. The design considerations on the feasible slot and pole combinations are discussed. The major performance such as output power and efficiency are predicted via finite element method. A prototype is built up and the design has been verified through experiments. The results indicate that a high operation frequency can improve the output power, and efficiency can be optimized by regulating the loads.

Abstract: Photovoltaic (PV) base can gather advantage resources, play the scale effect and greatly reduce the cost of PV power generation. It is an important direction for the large-scale development of PV generation in the world. Traditionally, PV power collection in PV plants is based on low voltage AC method which will cause high net losses. Meanwhile, PV plants accessing to the AC power grid are limited by the system capacitive reactance, harmonic resonance, reactive power transmission problem and other problems. PV plants through DC collection method has many advantages compared with AC collection and represents an important trend in the future. The efficiency of the full DC system is about 2 %,~3 % higher than the centralized AC system. The paper studied the DC-series of PV plant, and analyzed the operating characteristics of DC-series PV plant, PV series branch and PV generation units in series branch. In order to evaluate the characteristics of the system, DC-series PV plant model was carried out in Matlab/Simulink.
Author Keywords: Photovoltaic (PV);DC-Series;Overvoltage;DC/DC Converter

Authors: Y. D. Chung; E. Y. Park; C. Y. Lee
Author Affiliations: Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Suwon Science College, Hwasung-si, Korea; Dept. of Food & Nutrition, Korea Christian University, Seoul, Korea; Korea Railroad Research Institute, Research center of high speed railroad systems, Uiwang-si, Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: As the wireless power transfer (WPT) technology based on strongly resonance coupled method realizes large power charging without any wires through the air, there are advantages compared with the wired counterparts, such as convenient, safety and fearless transmission of power. From this reason, the WPT systems have started to be applied to the wireless charging for various power applications such as transportations (train, underwater ship, electric vehicle). Especially, in the case of high speed magnetic levitation (MAGLEV) train, The MAGLEV systems inherently have advantages in higher efficiency due to smaller air gap for wireless power transfer system between guidance and train. Even though it makes possible a convenient power charging system based on strong resonance coupling method, the transfer efficiency is limited structurally. This study aims for the design of inserted resonance coil (Sx) between antenna (Tx) and receiver (Rx) coils with high efficiency and stability in wireless power charging system for high speed MAGLEV train. In this study, authors described design methodology of inserted resonance coils to improve the efficiency for form of different sizes of Sx coil with radio frequency (RF) power of 370 kHz 400 W.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, a principle of microgrid variable reactor with filtering function using transformer and inverter is proposed to solve the problems of control deviation caused by harmonic pollution in microgrid and the variable reactor's discontinuous adjustment. Firstly, it introduces the principle of variable reactor. A transformer with air gap is chosen and the voltage of the transformer's primary winding is detected and functioned as the reference signal after filtering, phase shift and superposition. A voltage source PWM inverter is applied to produce a voltage source, which follows the reference signal and energizes the secondary winding of the transformer so that the equivalent impedance of primary winding can present a four-quadrant continuously variable impedance to fundamental and infinite impedance to harmonic. The stability condition is also analyzed. The simulation results show the effectiveness and excellent filtering characteristic of the proposed microgrid variable reactor with filtering function.

Abstract: In human transportation field, like electric vehicle and high-speed train, the insulated gate bipolar transistor (IGBT) module is more and more widely used. In this paper the typical automotive and industrial grade IGBT products were selected, and both the power cycling and thermal cycling tests were carried out to compare the reliability difference. A structure of prototype is made from aluminum. Two units of 12 V of actuator linear motor [1]-[3] are used for moving up and down the lid of the lavatory. Both motors are controlled to rotate in the same direction and can bear the weight up to 120 kg. Abstract: Interior Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motor (IPMSM) is driven by AC current and it generates some losses due to frequency. Especially, the electric vehicle (EV) traction motor that requires a wide operating range are more likely to suffer these losses at high-speed region. One of these losses is AC copper loss. The main factors that cause AC copper loss are skin effect, proximity effect and leakage flux. In this paper, the effect of these factors on AC copper loss of IPMSM is analyzed and the method for reducing AC copper loss is proposed. To verify reliability of the analysis, 2D-FEA (2D-Finite Elements Analysis) software tool is employed.

Abstract: This paper discusses the design of a high efficient battery charger and control technique for EV fast charger. Existing EV fast charger systems used two-stage (AC/DC, DC/DC) as a single module to increase the output power. However, the existing method has the problem of increasing the unit price of EV fast charger as the number of AC/DC converters also increases. This study proposes overcoming this problem using a 25-kW high efficiency fast charger that uses a single AC/DC converter and four DC/DC converter modules. In addition, a converter with a module structure was applied for maximum efficiency tracking, and the control and design of the Vienna rectifier were conducted accordingly. Abstract: This paper presents a virtual d-q control strategy for capacitor-split type active power decoupling circuits. The performance of single-phase ac-dc converters is inherently degraded by the well-known double-line frequency ripple power. Active power decoupling circuits have emerged to resolve undesirable ripple power in single-phase power systems while using minimized dc capacitances. The proposed algorithm employs a virtual d-q transform technique to control an inductor current in the decoupling circuit, resulting in high performance in tracking references even with a low bandwidth current-loop compensator. The effectiveness of the proposed algorithm was verified by a MATLAB simulation.

Abstract: Three-phase squirrel-cage induction motors (IMs) are widely used in various applications of electrical machinery, and therefore their cost must be greatly reduced. Therefore, the deterioration of the characteristics is inevitable. In addition, sufficient research has not been conducted for CW-IMs. Thus, we have studied how to improve CW-IM to achieve a high performance and reduce cost. This paper reports on the basic characteristics of CW-IM compared with a distributed winding IM, and the effect of the number of rotor slots on CW-IM is demonstrated using finite-element-method.

Abstract: In the field of AC permanent magnet synchronous motor control, the current loop is the innermost ring of the servo control system, and its bandwidth represents the dynamic performance of the control system. The main factors that restrict the current loop bandwidth are digital delay and switching frequency. At present, power devices which can sustain the high switching frequency are expensive and some relative technologies are not yet mature. So the main way of expanding the current loop bandwidth is to reduce digital delay of the control loop. In this paper, Multiple stator current sampling and multiple PWM duty cycle update were achieved in a carrier period without changing the switching frequency. Thereby, with the current loop bandwidth extended, the dynamic performance of the current loop is enhanced. Finally, the simulation results all verify the effectiveness of the algorithm.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: BLDC motor(Brushless DC Motor) is used in various applications like scientific studies, industrial, medical device industry and so on. Recently, medical device needs high torque, high efficiency motor and most of motor used in medical device are BLDC motor. Compared to motor used in other application, motor used in medical device has more restrictions on control simplicity and small sizing. If diameter and stacking length are different from initial size condition, medical device production is impossible. If initial size condition is changed, all internal configuration of medical device changes. For this reason, BLDC motor used in medical device designing has to meet initial condition. To meet small sizing and control simplicity, BLDC motor has structure of SPM type BLDC. In case of SPM type, rotor structure can be designed by Poles and permanent magnet shape. According to magnet size, air gap clearance changes and torque of motor changes. Optimized magnet size is able to be chosen by magnetic equivalent circuit. This paper show optimization of designing small size BLDC motor.

Authors: H. Kang; S. Hwang
Author Affiliations: Kyungnam University, Deparment of Electrical Engineering, Changwon, South Korea; Kyungnam University, Deparment of Electrical Engineering, Changwon, South Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper presents a startup method of high speed operation single-phase brushless dc motor based on virtual DQ model by applying variable all-pass filter. Generally, the rotor position information is required to control the BLDCM and can be obtained by using the position detection sensor. However, the position detection sensor is disadvantage such as expensiveness, additional installation space, sensitive temperature and noise etc. In order to overcome this disadvantage, the sensorless control algorithm that eliminate the position detection sensor have been studied continuously. The model-based sensorless control method can estimate the back-EMF from the voltage equation of the BLDCM and detect the rotor position by using the estimated back-EMF. However, the sensorless control based on back-EMF is difficult to detect the rotor position at a low speed and standstill because the back-EMF is proportional to the rotor speed. In this paper, a virtual DQ model startup algorithm based on I-f is proposed that it considers smooth transition operation with current controller for sensorless operation. The usefulness and effectiveness are verified through several experimental result.

Abstract: A novel electrolytic capacitor-less (ECL) power converter equipped with shared inductor is proposed in this paper to achieve high input power factor(P.F.) and lower DC-bus voltage ripple in Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motor (PMSM) drive system. Due to the high voltage ripple operating mode of the capacitor, the power decoupling is achieved with small film capacitor. In addition, only one inductor is adopted in the converter to acts as the grid harmonic and output current filter simultaneously. Thus, the size and costs of the converter can be reduced. Based on the simulation and experimental results, the grid current can satisfy the standard of IEC61000-3-2, and the lower DC-bus voltage fluctuation can improve the motor performance. This verifies the feasibility and validity of the whole system.

Document Title: Instability Mitigation of a Three-Phase Diode Rectifier Feeding a Controlled Buck Converter by Using the Active Damping Method
Authors: T. Sopapirm
Author Affiliations: Faculty of Engineering, Mahanakorn University of Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Bangkok, Thailand
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Power converters with their controls normally behave as constant power loads. These loads have small-signal negative impedance to the system. The negative impedance of controlled buck converter can degrade the system stability. Therefore, this paper presents the mitigation technique to eliminate the destabilizing effect of controlled buck converter for AC-DC power systems. The proposed mitigation technique is based on the active method which is normally used in DC-DC converters. As for the AC-DC power system, measuring the inductor current of the AC-DC power system and subtracting it form the control voltage. The virtual resistance can then be used to increase the filter damping via adjusting the duty cycle of controlled buck converter. As a result, the AC-DC feeder system can return to stable operation when the proposed stabilization is activated. The stability analysis and simulation results are used to verify the effectiveness of the proposed active damping stabilization.

Document Title: An Effective Control Strategy Based on DC-Link Voltage Regulation for an Electrolytic Capacitor-Less IPMSM Drive
Authors: M. F. Khan; W. Li; Q. Gao
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering%, Shanghai Jiaotong University, Shanghai, China; Department of Electrical Engineering%, Shanghai Jiaotong University, Shanghai, China; Department of Electrical Engineering%, Shanghai Jiaotong University, Shanghai, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Small film DC-link capacitors are used nowadays to increase reliability of IPMSM power drives. However, due to decrease in energy storing capability, DC-link voltage oscillation seems inevitable which challenges the control for rectifier and inverter. Extensive research has been done to regulate the oscillation in a standard six-switch three-phase inverter. However, effect of motor speed transients on DC-link voltage has not been considered in this standard inverter, where mostly the grid input current control and the motor control are not decoupled, making the control very complex. In this paper, an electrolytic capacitor-less control scheme for a low cost converter comprising of a half bridge controlled rectifier and a four-switch three-phase inverter (FSTPI) is proposed, which can regulate the DC-link voltage not only at constant speeds but also during speed transients. Absorbed power by small film capacitors is regulated by controlling stored energy in them, which aims to make DC-link voltage follow its reference value. Effectiveness of the proposed method is verified by simulation results. It is observed that the harmonics of the input grid current meets the IEC 61000-3-2 standard.
Author Keywords: Interior permanent magnet synchronous motors;predictive control;electrolytic capacitor-less inverter;MTPA

Document Title: Control Strategy of Super Capacitor-Battery Hybrid Energy Storage System Considering Constant Power Loads Characteristics
Authors: X. Liu; Y. Zou
Author Affiliations: North China University of Technology, Beijing, China; North China University of Technology, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In DC microgrid, most of tightly regulated converters can be regarded as constant power loads (CPLs), and may cause negative incremental impedance instability problem. The hybrid energy storage system (HESS) plays an important role in suppressing power fluctuations and voltage instability. This paper proposes a control strategy for HESS consist of super capacitors and batteries, and the effects of CPLs are considered. A high-pass filter is utilized to distribute power for super capacitors and batteries, separately. During identifying power fluctuations procedure, the power frequency and the negative incremental impedance of CPLs are both considered. Based on the Takagi-Sugeno (T -S) fuzzy model, the large signal model of DC microgrid is established. Then the stability constraints are deduced by Lyapunov theorem, and are taken into HESS control strategies. The proposed control strategy could fully exploit the advantages of large power density of super capacitor and high energy density of battery, and simultaneously could stabilize the voltage. Simulation results verify the validity of the control strategy.

Authors: P. T. Luu; J. Lee; W. Hwang; B. Woo
Author Affiliations: Energy and Power Conversion Eng., University of Science and Technology, Daejoen, Korea; Energy and Power Conversion Eng., University of Science and Technology; Korea Electrotechnology Research Institue, Electric Motor Research Center, Changwon, Korea; Korea Electrotechnology Research Institue, Electric Motor Research Center, Changwon, Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper presents a design approach of a permanent magnet synchronous motor to use effectively the space of the housing inside by considering the axial asymmetry position of the rotor to the stator. This approach helps to utilize the motor space effectively, and make compact size and light weight. However, when the rotor and stator are offset from each other in axial direction, the axial attractive force (AAF) is generated, which is able to generate noise and vibration of the motor. To obtain the stability of the motor in this case, the bearing should be properly chosen. To avoid losing the space secured in the axial asymmetric position by a larger bearing than necessary, AAF were calculated and analyzed to select the proper bearing. Firstly, the AAF depending on the axial position of the rotor to the stator is investigated by three-dimensional finite element analysis (3-D FEA). The torque is also calculated under the same condition to verify that the system requirements are met. Then, the bearing type is selected to ensure that the allowable load of the bearing is higher than the value of both AAF and radial force of the motor. Based on the analysis results, the proper axial position of the rotor with respect to the stator is proposed. Finally, the experiment is conducted to validate the accuracy of the analysis result.
Author Keywords: axial asymmetric;axial attractive force;bearing;permanent magnet synchronous machine

Abstract: This paper proposes a novel detent force reduction method for subway applications, in which four primary permanent magnet liner motors (PMLMs) are employed in traction system. The detent force of the traction system is influenced by space distance between movers. The detent force can be reduced twice by setting optimal space distances. In order to remain the passenger capacity of the train remaining constant, the average thrust is not reduced and the thrust fluctuation is become smaller. Hence, the thrust becomes more stable and the safety of the train operation is improved. The effectiveness of the proposed reduced method has been verified by simulation results.

Abstract: In order to suppress the input current harmonics of an indirect matrix converter (IMC), in this paper, the causes and mechanism are analyzed thoroughly, and the components and content of the harmonics are clarifies by introducing the center of gravity of the pulse. According to the regularity of the harmonics found in this paper, a pulse width distribution method based on dual-space vector modulation (SVM) is proposed, by using which the main low-order harmonic can be minimized. Simulation results under different conditions coincide with the theoretical analysis on the input current harmonics, and the results show the 5<sup>th</sup>order harmonic, which is the main component, is reduced obviously by using the proposed pulse width distribution method.

Abstract: One cycle control(OCC) is widely used in the DC-DC converter owing to its good dynamic performance. By adopting OCC, the average value of the switched variable is equal to or proportional to the control reference in one cycle. However, the clearing signal depends on the comparison result, which affects the dynamic performance of the OCC. Therefore, an OCC method adopting the constant frequency clock as the clearing signal is proposed in this paper to enhance the dynamic performance, in which the integration value is cleared regularly regardless of the comparison result. Abstract: In this paper, the cascade controller for the power converters is proposed to guarantee the system stability and the output tracking performance. The cascade linearization technique will be proposed to control the nonlinear states of power converters. In this technique, the previous state of power converter will be controlled to become a control input for the next state. A convergence property of high gain observer is used to analyze the stability of the proposed cascade controller. A sliding mode controller is also designed to guarantee the system convergence. The numerical examples with respect to the CUK converter are presented to show the validity of the proposed controller design strategy. To investigate the stability and the convergence property of the proposed controller, the simulation study is performed by using PSIM® tool.

Authors: Z. Piao; Y. Zhong

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In multi-inverter parallel system, the complex coupling between the inverters leads to the resonance of the system. In this paper, the equivalent model of parallel operation of multi-inverter is established. The resonance principle and resonance characteristics of multi-inverter parallel connection are analyzed. Aiming at the system high-frequency resonance caused by nonsynchronous control between inverters, this paper makes functional reuse for grid-connected inverters to ensure the control of fundamental frequency. Meanwhile, the virtual impedance is put into the harmonic range to improve the system damping and restrain the high frequency resonance in the specific frequency range. In addition, in the current control of the harmonic range, the Quasi-PR controller is used for zero steady-state error tracking of harmonic currents. The simulation results show that the proposed method is effective.

Authors: D. Han; K. Yoo; P. Lee; S. Kim; S. Kim; J. Kim
Author Affiliations: Electrical engineering, Chungnam National University, Daejeon, Korea; Youngnam National University, Mechanical engineering, Daegu, Korea; Electrical engineering, Chungnam National University, Daejeon, Korea; Electrical engineering, Chungnam National University, Daejeon, Korea; Electrical engineering, Chungnam National University, Daejeon, Korea; Electrical engineering, Chungnam National University, Daejeon, Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The vanadium redox flow battery (VRFB) consists of the electrodes, pump, and membrane, but the pump is causative of self-discharge because it continuously operated the ions diffusion through membrane. Thus, the equivalent circuit of VRFB should consider the self-discharge to enhance the accuracy of the state of charge (SOC) estimation. This paper proposes the equivalent circuit model of VRFB, which is comprised of the basic RC ladder. In addition, to consider the self-discharge of VRFB the proposed equivalent circuit takes into account that the capacitance of the vanadium redox flow battery is changed by the charging and discharging cycles. The self-discharge test profile was proposed by applying the decreased capacity depending on cycles, and the derived amount of self-discharge was applied to the RC ladder based equivalent circuit model based on resistance. The parameters for the equivalent circuit model is extracted by the actual experimental data. The equivalent circuit model with the basic RC ladder is modeled by using MATLAB/Simulink. Based on the equivalent circuit model considering self-discharge, EKF (Extended Kalman filter) suitable for nonlinear system of vanadium redox flow battery was used for SOC estimation.
INSPEC Controlled Terms: equivalent circuits;flow batteries;Kalman filters;Matlab;power engineering computing;RC circuits

Abstract: An imbalance of the battery pack in the voltage and state of charge (SOC) leads to problems in the lifetime, performance, and safety. This paper proposes the optimal cell screening method using K-means clustering algorithm, which is one of the unsupervised learning methods. Authors: Y. Ishii; H. Dohmeki; K. Suzuki

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Steer-by-wire system (SBW), which is a new steering system, is expected to be adapt automated driving vehicles. However, SBW has problems with increasing cost and redundancy and these hinder its popularization. Recently, a lot of research about SBW has proposed a system using disturbance torque observer to obtain steering torque or reaction torque with low costs. A resolution of a position sensor directly affects the disturbance estimation accuracy at this time, so a high resolution position sensor is required for the system. But it is inappropriate for SBW to adopt it because of increasing costs. In this paper, therefore, we aim to improve the estimation accuracy of disturbance torque observer with keeping low cost. For that purpose, we propose new method which can improve the position information accuracy by using instantaneous speed observer, and we compare the result between new method and conventional one.

Abstract: This paper proposes the Angular-Shifted Carrier-based PWM (ASCPWM) method for multiphase open- end drives with single DC voltage source, where the two modulation waves of the two converters for each phase are displaced in phase-angles. Abstract: The influence of rotor slot number on the flux-weakening performance of a variable speed induction machine is studied in this paper. The impact of a particular rotor slot number is closely related to the numbers of poles and stator slots. The influence of the number of rotor slots for a range of pole numbers and slots per pole per phase on leakage inductance, magnetizing inductance, torque and torque ripple is discussed. The induction machines with the same outer diameter, stack length and drive circuit are compared over a wide range of slot/pole combinations by analytical and finite element methods. The corresponding optimum rotor slot number that maximizes the operating speed range and minimizes torque ripple is determined.

Abstract: Most stand-alone Photovoltaic (PV) systems require batteries for energy storage to eliminate the mismatch between the power produced by the PV array and the power required by the load. These batteries essentially suffer from premature failure if operating under overcharge and deep discharge. To refrain from the aforementioned destructive conditions and thus preserve the service life, not only the battery state of charge (SoC) but also the terminal voltage should be followed. This paper presents battery modeling by means of the artificial neural network method to predict the battery terminal voltage, incorporating the ampere-hour (Ah) counting method for SoC estimation. Providing conventional data are given by the battery manufacturer the model is trained by using the neural network tools in MATLAB. Consequently, the derived model can be used to simulate the battery behavior and hence cooperated with design of promising battery control strategies.

To estimate the remaining useful life of the bearing, the confidence of accelerated life test needs to be validated. First, the properties of bearing depend on bearing state are analyzed. The accelerated life test conditions are established following bearing state. In addition, the fault condition is defined by the acoustic noise changes. Finally, the results of normal condition test and accelerated life test are compared to validate the confidence of accelerated life test. By validated accelerated life test, the remaining useful life and changes by bearing degradation can be investigated easily. In addition, accumulating historical data of degraded bearings can be facilitated.

Abstract: A four-phase fault-tolerant permanent-magnet (PM) machine is designed for aerospace application. The causes of PM loss and torque ripple are analyzed under the condition of adopting fractional slot concentrated winding (FSCW) and surface-mounted PM structure. Then the Quasi-Halbach PM structure is introduced to reduce the PM loss and torque ripple. Furthermore, the machine performances are improved by optimizing the PM thickness, magnetization angle, rotor core thickness and slot-opening width. Besides, performances of the proposed machine under different open-circuit faults are analyzed, and corresponding open-circuit fault-tolerant control strategies with zero sequence current taken into consideration are investigated.

Document Title: Power Factor Improvement and Inrush Current Reduction of a Grid Connected Split-Phase Induction Generator
Authors: N. Prapurt; B. Sawetsakulanond; V. Kinnares
Author Affiliations: mahanakorn university of technology, department of electrical engineering, Bangkok, Thailand; mahanakorn university of technology, department of electrical engineering, Bangkok, Thailand; King mongkut's institute of technology ladkrabang, department of electrical engineering, Bangkok, Thailand
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposes power factor improvement and inrush current reduction of a 1/2 HP, 220 V, 4.8 A, 4 poles single-phase grid connected split phase induction generator by connecting a capacitor for reactive compensation and a single-phase ac voltage controller for reducing inrush current during starting of the grid connected induction generator. Analysis and comparison of generator performance between calculation with an equivalent circuit and testing in a laboratory are given. Simulation of the generator operation during starting of connection with the power system using MATLAB/Simulink is also included. From testing results, it is found that the capacitor can improve power factor but it causes an increase in harmonic currents. Soft starting of the grid connected generator with the ac voltage controller offers a reduction in the peak inrush current with 75-80% of the peak inrush current with direct on line start. The simulation results using MATLAB/Simulink are in good agreement with testing and theoretical results. The research results are guidelines for single-phase grid induction generator applications in effective electricity production.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The insufficient ability to withstand short circuit of power transformer seriously affects the safety of power system, so it is very necessary to calculate short circuit strength of windings accurately. Two-dimensional electromagnetic-structure coupling method is applied to calculate the mechanical properties of windings for a 110 kV power transformer and the stress and axial displacement of the transformer windings are analyzed and compared in short-circuit fault under the two kinds of commonly used preload loading modes, which are loading at one or both ends of the windings. The result reflects the stress and displacement distribution of the windings are different under the two kinds of preload loading modes. Considering the symmetry of the mechanical performance distribution of windings in practical engineering, the method of preload loading at both ends of the windings in numerical simulation of the mechanical performance of the windings is more accurate.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Since the flux due to permanent magnets (PMs) cannot be turned off in short-circuit condition, the short-circuit fault in permanent-magnet synchronous machine (PMSM) is quite devastating. The detection of short-circuit fault is the prerequisite of taking preventive steps. In this paper, an online short-circuit fault detection method which is based on search coil is developed for a five-phase 30-slot/32-pole permanent-magnet synchronous machine (PMSM). The optimal configuration of search coil is studied with different load conditions and fault-occurring positions considered, further the optimal inserted position is determined. With the parallel strands of windings considered, the performance of the proposed short-circuit fault detection method is evaluated, which provides guidance for the design of the short-circuit fault detection system.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Battery ferries and hybrid ferries attract lot of interests due to zero emissions when they are powered by batteries. The onboard batteries on the battery or hybrid ferries are mostly charged when the ferries are at quay. This study investigates the different solutions of battery charging system for the ferries. Different topologies including active-front-end, thyristor rectifier and diode rectifier are presented both in principle and simulation results. Comparison of different topologies in both technical and practical aspects are carried out in power factor, current total harmonic distortion, volume, voltage controllability and bidirectional power flow capability, and cost. The conclusion is that the active-front-end solution is more suitable for charging the battery and hybrid ferries than the other topologies, and has better performance.

Abstract: This paper describes a modular PSA system for hydrogen separation and purification of hydrogen stations. The PSA system for hydrogen separation in the hydrogen station process has the advantage of energy efficiency, but it has a disadvantage that it is bulky. To reduce this drawback of hydrogen PSA, we have studied PSA system in the form of unit module using several beds. By using the unit module type PSA system, the efficiency can be increased and the volume can be reduced. A multi-bed was filled with an adsorbent, and a four-component hydrogen mixture (H2, CO, CH4, CO<sub>2</sub>) was used as the feed gas. Authors: T. Mutou; H. Shirahama
Author Affiliations: dept. Electronical Engineering, Fukuoka Institute of Technology, Fukuoka, Japan; dept. Electronical Engineering, Fukuoka Institute of Technology, Fukuoka, Japan
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In order to perform high speed power control between a renewable energy source such as sunlight or wind power and the power system, a large capacity self-extinguishing power conversion device is necessary. However, it faces a technical problem to connecting the self-extinguishing devices in series. To solve the above-mentioned problem, MMC (Modular Multilevel Converter) is expected as a means to realize it. In order to operate the MMC stably, it is necessary to suppress the voltage fluctuation of the capacitor of cell capactance. Therefore, the choice of the PWM method and capacitor capacity become important. In this paper, the PWM method to suppress the capacitor voltage fluctuation is selected, and clarified the relationship between the voltage fluctuation and the current, the duty, and the load power factor of the capacitor of cell capactance. In addition, in the selected PWM method, the THD of each output current when the capacitor capacity was changed to find the suitable capacitor capacity was obtained. Furthermore, the PWM method and capacitor of cell capactance to suppress capacitor voltage fluctuation are confirmed by the simulation of MATLAB-Simulink and using a single-phase 3-level MMC circuit, the simulation and the actual machine test were compared.

Abstract: In this paper, a direct torque control (DTC) method without flux linkage loop is investigated for permanent magnet synchronous motor (PMSM). In this proposed DTC, the proper voltage vectors are selected according to the sector position of rotor flux to control the torque directly. Therefore, the flux linkage loop to keep a constant amplitude of stator flux is eliminated. The space voltage vectors with varying rotor and stator flux positions are first analyzed. The switching table for this method is optimized based on the analysis above. The comparison between this method and traditional DTC is carried out on a prototype motor. The experimental results show that the proposed DTC is simple and can effectively provide accurate torque control with reduced torque ripple and quick dynamic performance.

Abstract: In the stray loss of asynchronous motor, the loss caused by the rotor lateral current occupies a large proportion. It is found that the rotor structure and material of asynchronous motor have great influence on the efficiency. By analyzing the composition types of rotor resistances, a rotor resistance distribution model of asynchronous motor is presented, and then the concept of rotor resistance distribution is described in this paper. Abstract: This paper presents a modular multilevel cascade converter-double-star bridge cells (MMCC-DSBC)-based windpower generation system (WPGS) with a vertical-axis wind turbine. The MMCC-DSBC-based WPGS can connect to a highvoltage grid without a transformer or a passive filter, because the MMCC-DSBC generates a multi-level voltage. An average voltage-fixed control of de-capacitor is used as the output voltage controller of the MMCC-DSBC. Therefore, a source current with unity power factor on the source side can be achieved. A computer simulation is implemented to confirm the validity and practicability of the proposed MMCC-DSBC based WPGS using a piece-wise linear electrical circuit simulation. Simulation results demonstrate that a source current with unity power factor is achieved under wind-speed fluctuation.

Document Title: Dual Magnetic Gear for Improved Power Density in High-Gear-Ratio Applications
Authors: E. Park; C. Kim; S. Jung; Y. Kim
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Chosun University Gwangju, Korea; Department of Electrical Engineering, Chosun University Gwangju, Korea; School of Electronic and Electrical Engineering Sungkyunkwan University Suwon, Korea; Department of Electrical Engineering, Chosun University Gwangju, Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Mechanical gears, which have applications in several modern industrial fields, are used mostly for power-transmitting mechanical devices. However, because the mechanical gear operates, in principle, by engaging the gear teeth, it is difficult to avoid problems, e.g., friction loss from physical contact, noise, and vibration. A magnetic-gear design that solves the physical-contact problems of mechanical gears has drawn considerable research attention. A magnetic gear has no mechanical friction loss, creates very little noise or vibration, and does not require lubricants. We attempt to apply magnetic gears to wind-turbine systems, which experience a catastrophic economic loss when the mechanical gears break down. However, a conventional magnetic gear has too low power density to support the high gear ratio required by the wind power-generation system. A novel shape for a high gear ratio is proposed and a design guide is shown.

Abstract: In this paper, the cascade controller using partial states of the CUK converter is proposed to guarantee the system stability and the output tracking performance. The cascade linearization technique using partial states will be proposed to control the CUK converter. In this technique, the previous state of power converter will be controlled to become a control input for the next state. A convergence property of high gain observer is used to analyze the stability of the proposed cascade controller. A sliding mode controller is also designed to guarantee the system convergence. The numerical examples with respect to the CUK converter using partial states are presented to show the validity of the proposed controller design strategy. To investigate the stability and the convergence property of the proposed controller, the simulation study is performed by using PSIM<sup>®</sup>tool.

Authors: L. SeungHyun; K. DoYoun; J. SungJun
Author Affiliations: Hoseo Universilty, Department of Information Control Engineering, Korea; Hoseo Universilty, Department of Digital Control Engineering, Korea; Hoseo Universilty, Department of Digital Control Engineering, Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Secondary batteries are different from the batteries that have been used in recent years, and are easily reusable and have a slight advantage. However, secondary batteries can generate high heat and become dangerous under certain conditions. An additional system is required to use the battery safely and for a long time. The system is called BMS and it detects the battery condition and stops operation before the battery shows any heat or swelling. BMS is used by one MCV and one protection circuit, and the battery can operate stably. If the MCV or protection circuit fails, the battery will operate at risk. We propose to use Dual-BMS to further strengthen stability assurance. When one BMS breaks down, the proposed dual-BMS hands over the command authority, protects the battery, delivers one broken BMS to the user and increases stability.

Abstract: This paper presents surface-mounted permanent magnet (SPM) motors with complicated permanent magnet shapes formed by binder-less net shaping process. Abstract: Modular Multilevel Converter (MMC) has attracted significant research attention in high voltage direct current transmission (HVDC) and medium voltage motor drive (MVD) because of its modularity, ease to expand structure and ideal sine-wave output waveform. But in MVD applications, the capacitor voltage ripple problem under low frequency is a challenge for MMC. In this regard, the hybrid MMC (HMMC) topology is a promising topology because of its inherent low capacitor voltage ripple, without adding additional common-mode voltage and circulating current. In this paper, the third-harmonic injection method based on HMMC is proposed to further reduce the capacitor voltage ripple. The expression of capacitor voltage ripple with third-harmonic injection is analyzed, which shows about 7% reduction of capacitor voltage ripple at low frequency. Effectiveness of the proposed method is verified by the simulation and experiments.

Authors: B. Hu; L. Kang; J. Cheng
Author Affiliations: New Energy Research Center of Electric Power College, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; New Energy Research Center of Electric Power College, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; New Energy Research Center of Electric Power College, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: When the unbalanced voltage occurs in grid, the current harmonic of converter with conventional model power predictive control (MPPC) will increase rapidly. In order to address this problem, the active and reactive powers DC components is deduced and expressed by the grid current, the grid voltage and the grid voltage quadrature signal with 90 electrical degrees delay. Meanwhile, the cost function of MPPC only includes the predictive value of the active and reactive power DC components. Thus, the improved MPPC regulate the active and reactive powers DC components directly to trace the reference active and reactive powers by selecting the optimal switching state (OSS). An experimental platform is established to validate the proposed approach. The experimental results show that the current harmonic is decreased remarkably and the waveforms of three grid current are close to purify sinusoidal wave.

Abstract: This paper presents a method for power swing and fault diagnosis of distributed generation (DG) system based on real-time and Support Vector Machine (SVM) classifier using LabVIEW NI myRIO. The method adopts real-time SVM classifier to identify the power swing and fault occurring in power system. The data input to SVM using Wavelet Packet Transform (WPT) extract current signals that calculate Rate of Change of Relative Wavelet Energy and symmetrical components. The process of training the SVM using a K-folded cross validation process for determining the appropriate values of parameter sigma σ in RBF kernel parameters can minimize the classification error. The experimental results, the LabVIEW NI myRIO processor can be detecting the power fluctuations that occur in the power system. Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Coaxial magnetic gears have the advantages of high efficiency and high reliability. However, when these magnetic gears operate, a torque ripple is generated because of the difference in magnetic resistance between the pole piece and the air. The torque ripple causes noise and vibration on the coaxial magnetic gear; therefore, it must be minimized during the design process. In this study, a pole piece with fillet was proposed to reduce torque ripple. Using a finite element analysis based on two-dimensional numerical analysis, the torque performances of the coaxial magnetic gears were compared and analyzed according to the fillet parameter value of the pole piece. Torque characteristics of magnetic gears were compared according to the various gear ratios, number of poles, and magnetic gear size. Then, the result shows that the effect of the parameters varies with the gear ratio of the magnetic gears.

Abstract: A planetary gear is adopted for the control implementation of power-assisted bikes due to the inherent two-input and one-output transmission feature. Authors: T. Dong; X. Wei; Y. Bai; Y. Zhang
Author Affiliations: Shenyang University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Shenyang, 110870, Liaoning, china; Shenyang University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Shenyang, 110870, Liaoning, china; Shenyang University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Shenyang, 110870, Liaoning, china; Shenyang University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Shenyang, 110870, Liaoning, china
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Due to the nonlinear influence of ferromagnetic materials, the saturation effect of the magnetic circuit becomes one of the main factors affecting the improvement of motor performance. Magnetic saturation is one of the major challenges for all electrical motors and makes it much more difficult to design high performance electrical motors. The magnetic permeability of the oriented silicon steel, which is often used in transformers, is significantly higher than that of the traditional silicon steel, and can provide a higher magnetic flux density for the motor. Firstly, the influence of the saturation effect of the magnetic circuit on the inductance parameters is analyzed. Secondly, using the finite element software Ansoft, the inductance parameters of the traditional silicon steel and oriented silicon steel PMLSMs are calculated with different loads. Simulation results show that the inductance of the surface-mounted PMLSM is no longer a constant due to the influence of the armature reaction with load. The magnetic saturation of the oriented silicon steel PMLSM decreases by 4.4% and 19% respectively at rated load and 5 times rated load, and its overload capacity is stronger.

Document Title: The Proportional Current Control Strategy for Equalization Circuits of Series Battery Packs
Authors: X. Liu; Y. Zou
Author Affiliations: North China University of Technology, Beijing, China; North China University of Technology, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In renewable energy power generation system, the battery storage unit is necessary for suppressing voltage fluctuations and ensuring stable operation. However, the cost of the battery storage unit is very expensive, and the life time of batteries is limited. In order to extend the service life as much as possible, rapid equalization circuits are needed for the series battery packs. Unfortunately, the equalization currents are almost small and uncontrollable. Based on Buck-Boost equalization circuit, this paper introduces the proportional current control strategy for equalization circuits of series battery packs. The state of charge (SOC) of each battery is considered in the strategy. The differences between the practical SOC values and the average SOC value are used to calculate the reference equalization currents to charge or discharge batteries. The improved current control strategy determines the duty cycle of the switches, while the voltage control loop determines the equalization direction of series packs. The derived strategy could realize accuracy control of equalization currents, and simultaneously, could achieve rapid equalization process. Experimental results verify the validity of the proposed control strategy.

Author Affiliations: Research and Development Department, Suzhou InnMag New Energy Ltd., Suzhou, China; YONGJI ELECTRIC CO., LTD., CRRC (China Railway Rolling Stock Corporation), Xi'an, China; YONGJI ELECTRIC CO., LTD., CRRC (China Railway Rolling Stock Corporation), Xi'an, China; YONGJI ELECTRIC CO., LTD., CRRC (China Railway Rolling Stock Corporation), Xi'an, China; InnMag New Energy Ltd., Suzhou, China; InnMag New Energy Ltd., Suzhou, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motor (PMSM) has been widely used in rail vehicle due to its remarkable advantage of high torque density, high efficiency and wide range of speed regulation. Optimizing the rotor design of PMSM, has become the main methods to achieve good sinusoidal wave form of air-gap flux density and to reduce the vibration noise. This paper mainly presents the principal of reducing air-gap flux harmonic by using double-layer rotor design. The finite element method is used in this paper to verify the air-gap magnetic density harmonic, the modal stiffness and the NVH performance of PMSM. By optimizing the wave shape of air-gap magnetic density, the peak efficiency of PMSM is up to 97% and the vibration noise reduce to 75dB, which is significantly lower than the induction motors among the same efficiency range. With this optimal rotor design, the PMSM can highly improve the competitiveness and performance compared to conventional induction motor.

Authors: J. Qiu; N. Lin; C. Shi

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: As for a Brushless DC Motor(BLDCM) with saliency pole structured rotor, the self-inductance and mutual inductance vary according to the rotor position. As a result, the difference between terminal voltage samples of floating phases during PWM on and free-wheeling period shows a regular change, which makes it possible to detect the rotor position. Based on the principle above, the initial rotor position detection is realized. A new sensorless commutation technique is proposed by comparing the terminal voltage sample difference with commutation thresholds. When the PWM duty cycle approaches 100%, a complementary rotor position detection method suitable for the extreme situation is applied. Thus, the rotor position can be detected in full-speed range. Experiment results verify that the saliency-based sensorless strategy is simple and effective.

Document Title: A Novel Control Method for Rotor Eddy Current Loss Reduction of High-Speed Permanent Magnet Brushless DC Motors
Authors: Q. Li; C. Shi; J. Qiu
Author Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering%, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou 310027, P. R. China; College of Electrical Engineering%, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou 310027, P. R. China; College of Electrical Engineering%, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou 310027, P. R. China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: High-speed brushless dc motor (BLDCM) has been widely used in many applications, but the rotor eddy current loss has always been a key constraint by traditional PWM control methods because of the serious distortion of stator current. Although this loss is only a small portion in the overall power loss, it still may expose the magnets to high risk of overheating and demagnetization, especially for the inner-rotor motors with weak cooling condition and motors operated at high-speed region. This paper presents a novel control method, asymmetrical dual-pulse (ASDP) variable conduction period control method, for high-speed permanent magnet BLDC motors to reduce the rotor eddy current loss. Comparative studies of stator current waveforms, harmonic components, and rotor eddy current loss have been carried out between the ASDP method and several traditional control methods. The FEM simulation and THD analysis results confirm that the ASDP method can effectively eliminate the even harmonic and weaken the odd harmonic components in stator current, so that the rotor eddy current loss can be significantly reduced.

Abstract: A design method for PM vernier motors (PM-VMs), which generate high torque at low speed, is proposed. The proposed design method is based on the voltage and torque equations of a PM-VM. According to these equations, the maximum output is proportional to the induced electromotive force and is inversely proportional to the synchronous reactance. Therefore, the output characteristics can be tuned by adjusting the number of armature winding turns and the iron core length. A maximum output of 6.6 kW, a power factor at the rated output of 91.3%, and an efficiency at the rated output of 92.6% were achieved. These values were directly calculated and verified using two-dimensional finite element analysis.

Abstract: High-speed permanent magnet synchronous motor (HSPMSM) is widely used in compressor applications as a result of its superior performance. However, high temperature rise is still a crucial problem for high-power HSPMSM. This paper proposes a 120kW, 17750rpm HSPMSM with a novel evaporative cooling configuration used in centrifugal compressor. Based on 2-D finite element method (FEM), electromagnetic design of the motor is carried out. The result of electromagnetic analysis suggests that the motor presents a good performance. Then, the cooling structure of the motor is elaborately introduced. Refrigerant R134a (1,1,1,2 tetrafluoroethane) flowing and evaporating inside the spiral channel provides an excellent cooling performance due to its huge specific latent heat. Steady state thermal analysis based on 2-D FEM is conducted in order to verify the cooling capacity of the new configuration, which shows the motor has a relatively low temperature rise. Therefore, a high efficiency and high reliability design of the motor is achieved, and it could provide a reference for similar motor design.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A robust observer based sensorless control method for the permanent magnet synchronous motor (PMSM) is proposed in this paper. First, the robust observer is proposed to estimate the back electromotive force (EMF) of the PMSM regardless of the uncertainty. Second, the stability of the proposed robust observer is analyzed by using the Lyaunov theory. Third, by the estimated back EMF, the phase locked loop (PLL) based approach is proposed to calculate the rotor position and speed of the PMSM. Finally, the simulation is conducted to verify the effectiveness of the proposed method. Compared with the traditional sliding mode observer (SMO), the proposed robust observer approach has the better system performance for the estimation of rotor position and speed, while it can effectively eliminate the chattering of the observer.
