Abstract: Medium and low speed maglev trains adopt ironless permanent magnet linear synchronous motor (IPMLSM) as their propulsion system. This kind of motor can reduce the normal attractive force between the mover and the stator, and it can also eliminate the cogging force, in the meantime, the problem caused by its flux leakage has drawn people's attention. In this paper, the leakage magnetic fields around the IPMLSM are calculated using 2-D and 3-D finite element methods (FEM). The calculation results include the magnetic fields distribution of the IPMLSM, and the range of flux leakage density equal to 5Gs, which indicates the safety distance people should keep from the motor. Some suggestions on the way to reduce the flux leakage are given as well, which offers the reference for the practical application of this motor.

Abstract: A dual-winding complementary suspension fault-tolerant control strategy for the six-phase and three-phase dual-winding bearingless flux-switching permanent magnet motor (BFSPMM) is proposed in this paper. If one phase of the six-phase winding is missing, the remaining 5 healthy phases can still generate torque, but the stability of the rotor suspension control is affected by the disturbance suspension force generated by current in the symmetric phase of missing phase. Therefore, a fault-tolerant control strategy for BFSPMM with two symmetric missing phases is studied in this paper. Let the remaining 4 healthy phases generate torque and compensation suspension force according to the principle that the copper loss of the suspension current is minimal. The compensation suspension force and the main suspension force generated by the three-phase windings achieve the stable suspension of the rotor. The theoretical analysis and Matlab simulation prove that the proposed control strategy is effective.

Abstract: This paper presents a novel cost-effective sensorless scheme for the start-up and operation of a standalone induction generator. The sensorless control system is based on full-order flux observer to estimate the rotation speed. The residual magnetism helps to estimate the speed of the rotor at the beginning when the full-order flux observer has not converged to the actual induction generator speed. After a certain time, the estimation of rotor speed through full-order flux observer began to work. The vector control method is applied in this scheme. The proposed method has been validated through simulation and verified on a 7.5 kW laboratory prototype.

Abstract: This paper studies optimal sizing method of distributed generations in DC microgrids (MGs). By employing particle swarm optimization (PSO) algorithm, optimal sizing problem can be solved as a nonlinear optimization process targeting at the lowest annualized capital cost. Moreover, in order to make the optimal sizing results more accurate, lifespan estimated model of batteries is considered in this paper to evaluate the replace period and cost of the batteries in DC MGs. Authors: M. Cao; H. Migita

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A high efficiency control of interior permanent magnet synchronous motors (IPMSM) with online parameter estimation is proposed in this paper. It is known that for high efficiency driving, it is necessary to control the armature current phase accurately. On the other hand, the optimal armature current phase is determined by the motor parameters. However, it is difficult to obtain the accurate motor parameters during driving because of magnet saturation, inductance variation and parameter dependency on temperature. In this paper, an online parameter estimation method by applying the recursive least squares method is proposed. The usefulness of the proposed method is verified through comparing the armature current between cases using online estimated parameters and using nominal parameters.

Authors: J. Kim; Y. Park
Author Affiliations: Gangneung-wonju National University, Korea; Gangneung-wonju National University, Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Induction generator has many advantages compared to the synchronous generator in terms of robust, cost and easy to maintenance. So the induction generator has been widely applied to small or medium size hydropower station in recent years. The induction generator generates a large inrush current corresponding to the starting current of the induction motor at the moment of grid connection. This inrush current can cause a voltage drop of the grid as well as the consumer load equipment, which may degrade the stability of the electric quality. It is very important to reduce the voltage drop due to the inrush current in order to improve the electric quality and increase the supply of the induction generator. In this study, we propose a solution to reduce the voltage drop and the inrush current by adjusting the parameters of the reactor tap and adjusting the appropriate operating pattern of the water turbine generator. As a result of the analysis, it was confirmed that the voltage drop can be adjusted within the allowable range.

Abstract: Recently, induction motors (IMs) have been used as power sources for industrial machines. In general, middle and small size IMs have skewed rotor-bar slots using die cast to reduce abnormal starting torque and electromagnetic vibration and noise. Then, the current in the direction of the rotation (inter-bar current) adversely affects the starting characteristics and decreases the motor efficiency of the IM. Hence, we have studied the effects of the inter-bar current on the characteristics of IM, which has a rotor with skewed slot, a rotor with a skewed slot and short-circuited by two aluminum rings, or a post-heated rotor. Abstract: This paper proposes a deep learning algorithm for motor fault detection. Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The medium voltage drive (MVD) is a high voltage alternating current variable frequency device developed and designed for the sugar mill plant in Thailand. The medium voltage drive features offer excellent performance, easy and convenient operation and a wide range of applications using IGBT power devices and complete digital control. Using multipulse input rectification transformer technology efficiently lowers the content of the grid side distortion current to less than 3%. The power cell rectifier is a regular six-pulse diode bridge. However, the phase-shift transformer is designed to combine all power cell input currents into a 24-pulse grid side current. It meets the IEEE 519-1992 standard and the strict requirements of electric grids for distortion, and enhances the power factor to more than 0.96 lagging. Finally, the comparative performances between 12-pulse, 18-pulse and 24-pulse converters are presented.

Abstract: Synchronous reluctance machine, permanent magnet assisted synchronous reluctance machine, and interior permanent magnet synchronous machine share the same kind of rotor topology. Comprehensive investigations on the correlation between the amount and function of the permanent magnets buried in the rotor have been carried out to reveal the intricate relationship of these machine types. Both circumferential and radial flux bridges are commonly employed to provide dependable rotor integrity in these machines. However, the flux bridge width has a tremendous bearing on both electromagnetic performance and mechanical ruggedness, especially for synchronous reluctance machine. In this paper, the active saturation method is hence applied in synchronous reluctance machine to strike the right balance between manufacturability and electromagnetic performance. A SkW@3000rpm synchronous reluctance machine with flux bridge width of 1mm has been optimized to realise the active saturation method. Moreover, the influence of permanent magnet location patterns on the active saturation method has been investigated in detail.

Abstract: In this paper, a magnetic pole(product level) and cylinder(sample level) made of SmCo are tested to evaluate its magnetic property in the ocean environment. Magnetic moment, and flux are inspected before and after the erosion test to evaluate their irreversible magnetization. 3D magnetic field of the magnetic pole which is immersed in the 50°C sea water is scanned to inspect its in-service magnetic property. Abstract: This paper aims to present a modified three-level full-bridge dc-dc converter that can operate under soft-switching conditions for all switches in the circuit. Abstract: SiC MOSFETs are expected to replace Si IGBTs in variable-speed motor drives applications for higher power density of inverters, e.g. in electric vehicle(EV), because of their high switching speed, high junction temperature and high blocking voltage. Common-mode voltage (CMV) which would bring common mode electromagnetic interference (EMI) and damage to motor bearings is an important performance index in electric drive system. However, the impact of high switching speed and high switching frequency on common-mode voltage is still ambiguous. In this paper, theoretical analyses are conducted by FFT to study the influence of high switching speed and high switching frequency on CMV and then the experimental verifications are carried out. On this basis, CMV is suppressed by the software and hardware methods. The experimental results show that either has the ability to restrain CMV. But, the best inhibition effect can be achieved by combining both.

Abstract: In order to avoid the tedious tuning work of weighting factor, reduce the computation burden and current ripples in conventional model prediction direct speed control (MPDSC), this paper proposes a novel double vector based model predictive direct speed control (DVMPDSC) strategy without weighting factor. In this paper, the principle of deadbeat control is adopted to obtain the reference voltage vector. This reference vector would be used to decide the optimal voltage vector and reduces the number of candidate voltage vectors. Authors: J. Dexter; L. Huang; Z. Q. Zhu; X. Vinamata
Author Affiliations: Department of Electronic and Electrical Engeineering, University of Sheffield, Sheffield, UK; Department of Electronic and Electrical Engeineering, University of Sheffield, Sheffield, UK; Department of Electronic and Electrical Engeineering, University of Sheffield, Sheffield, UK; Jaguar Land Rover Ltd Gaydon, UK
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, the discrepancies in torque production and design parameters (particularly rotor pole arc) for switched reluctance machines (SRMs) and variable flux reluctance machines (VFRMs) are analyzed. The analytical torque equations are derived for both machines. From this, the average torque production is found to be proportional to the fundamental self-inductance component, which is maximized via variance in rotor pole arc during optimization. Firstly, the analysis is performed under linear conditions, then taking into account saturation with the aid of the frozen permeability method. When the core is non-linear and both machines are operated under the same copper loss conditions with a fixed stator pole arc, the VFRM suffers from more saturation than the SRM. Consequently, the optimal rotor pole arc of VFRM for maximizing the fundamental inductance and average torque are always smaller than those of the SRM under all load conditions.

Document Title: Research on the Influence of Cooling Methods on Parasitic Parameters of IGBT Modules
Authors: Y. Kang; Z. Li; L. Ruan; Y. Wen; C
Author Affiliations: University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, beijing, China; University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, beijing, China; University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, beijing, China; University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: With the increasing power density and application of IGBT modules, heat dissipation technology has become the key to IGBT module research. Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences proposed to apply evaporative cooling technology to IGBT modules. Evaporative cooling technology can better solve the problem of heat dissipation of IGBT modules. In an evaporative cooling environment, changes in the operating environment of the IGBT module may affect parasitic parameters within the module. Parasitic parameters are one of the factors that affect the operating state of the IGBT module. The presence of parasitic inductance inside the module can cause the module to generate a large number of voltage spikes during the switching process. Overvoltage can increase the collector current of the module and increase the internal temperature, which may cause device failure. This paper first uses SolidWorks software to model the IGBT, and then extracts the internal parasitic inductance and parasitic resistance of the module through the finite element software ANSYS Q3D Extractor. By setting the background material, the parasitic parameters inside the module under air cooling and evaporative cooling conditions are obtained. The comparison data obtains the influence of the cooling method on the parasitic parameters of the IGBT module, which provides a basis for further application of the evaporative cooling technology to the IGBT module.
Author Keywords: evaporative cooling technology;IGBT module;parasitic parameters

Abstract: In this study the dynamic capability of the Electric Variable Transmission (EVT) is presented based on the tracking of a highly dynamic oscillating load. The targeted applications are 3-phase grid connected machines with periodic motions at high frequencies (> 5) Hz, which result in a high alternating to average power ratio (> 5). The overall consumed grid energy is minimized by a high-level non-parametric cascaded control to recuperate the oscillating load energy in a mechanical energy storage component. Document Title: Improving Torque and Speed Estimation Accuracy by Conjoint Parameter Identification and Unscented Kalman Filter Design for Induction Machines
Authors: O. Wallseheid; M. Schenke; J. Böcker
Author Affiliations: Department of Power Electronics and Electrical Drives%, Paderborn University, Germany; Department of Power Electronics and Electrical Drives%, Paderborn University, Germany; Department of Power Electronics and Electrical Drives%, Paderborn University, Germany
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Any model-based control of induction machines (IM) is sensitive to incorrect model parameters and measurement errors when utilized in an open-loop torque or speed-sensorless drive. Thus, various publications are available which address the IM's parameter identification as well as the flux- and speed-observer design. Classically, this is handled as a separated two-step procedure. However, measurement uncertainty negatively affects the IM identification result and, consequently, the uncertainty regarding the IM's parameter is then adversely affecting the observer design. In contrast to that, this contribution is proposing a conjoint observer design and machine identification process by one global optimization. As the observer tuning and machine identification have the same objective, i.e. being able to control a given drive with highest speed and torque accuracy, there is no compelling reason to separate them from each other. Hence, more degrees of freedom are given to the optimization process. Whereas an unscented Kalman filter (UKF) is applied as a flux- and speed-observer, sensor noise is taken into account due its internal working principle. Experimental test bench evaluations prove the feasibility of the proposed method, however, the achievable estimation accuracy is worse compared to a similar approach using an extended Kalman filter instead of the UKF.
Author Keywords: induction motor;system identification;parameter estimation;Kalman filter;optimization;control

Abstract: As the brushless DC (BLDC) motor is getting widely used in industry, vehicle and home appliances, it is necessary to design to satisfy the performance specification. But because of switching current signal, the BLDC shows different performances in ideal current source analysis and six-step voltage source analysis. Actually, as the BLDC derived by the voltage source, the performance in voltages source analysis is more accurate compared with that of current source analysis. In this paper, the structural design methodology considering response time of phase current in BLDC motor is suggested through comparative analysis between two BLDC motor which designed in different design concepts.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper introduces a vector hysteresis operator based on the physical mechanisms of the magnetic material. With the help of the schematic diagrams of energy barrier and the traditional wind-rose method, the magnetization orientation of each operator under different rotational magnetic field can be determined, as well as the rotation process of the corresponding magnetization. Meanwhile, a two-dimensional distribution function is utilized to describe the density of the interacting operators in the given specimen. To verify this rotational hysteresis model, the magnetic properties of soft magnetic composite SOMALOY™ 500 under different rotational excitations have been simulated and compared with the experimental results. Besides, the error analysis has been given to demonstrate the significance of parameters in the distribution function. The comparison shows the practicability of this vector operator and the wind-rose method.

Authors: B. Zhang; Q. Ge; X. Wang; Z. Li; Y. Li

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Five-level neutral point clamped H-bridge (NPCH) converter has found practical application due to its low EMI and high output capacity, however, the unequal losses distribution of the semiconductor devices affect the lifetime and the output power of NPCH, to reduce the switching loss, the NPCH converter usually operates at low-switching-frequency, the traditional power loss calculation model is mainly applicable for high switching frequency. In this paper, the operation principle and loss distribution of NPCH converter are described in detail, a discrete power loss evaluation method for low switching frequency is proposed. Based on the loss evaluation results, a loss balancing control scheme is presented. Results show that the loss distribution can be balanced in NPCH converter, enabling a substantially increased output power.

Authors: M. Hongbo; L. Hongmei; L. Liwen; M. Mingna; C. Zhiwei
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: For an optimal design of synchronous reluctance motor (SRM), rotor topology and the choice of numerous design variables remain a significant challenge. Generally, the rotor of SRM is only designed in the axial or radial direction, and the design variables are reduced based on experience; however, the above process is time-consuming. In this paper by comparing performances of SRM with different pole/slot combinations and the numbers of flux barriers, the SRM topology with 4-poles/36-slots combinations, distributed windings, and three-layer flux barrier is first proposed. And then, the step-skewed rotor with asymmetry flux barriers and flat tips are adopted. Further, the Taguchi method, differential evolution (DE) algorithm and Pareto evaluation are integrated to implement the sequence subspace multi-objective optimization, the proposed SRM design scheme is obtained. Finally, a 3kW SRM prototype is designed and its FEA (finite element analysis) is carried out to validate the technical advantages of proposed SRM topology and design methods.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposes the combined frequency support scheme of a wind generator (WG) and battery to improve the frequency nadir when a large disturbance occurs in the power system. The WG mainly improves the frequency nadir using an adaptable gain depending on the rotor speed and frequency deviation. In addition, to reinforce the frequency control of a WG the battery connected into the wind power plant (WPP) releases the stored energy based on the state of charge, the rotor speed of a WG, and the frequency deviation. The performance of the proposed scheme is investigated in IEEE 14-bus system, which includes a WPP based on the doubly-fed induction generator and the battery using an EMTP-RV simulator. As the results, the proposed scheme can improve the frequency nadir for a synchronous generator trip by supporting more active power.

Author Affiliations: Chinese Academy of Sciences Key Lab. of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Chinese Academy of Sciences The State Key Lab of Heavy Duty AC Drive Electric Locomotive Systems Integration, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Zhuzhou, Beijing, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences Key Lab. of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Chinese Academy of Sciences Collaborative Innovation Center of Electric Vehicles in Beijing, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences Key Lab. of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Chinese Academy of Sciences Collaborative Innovation Center of Electric Vehicles in Beijing, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A new speed-sensorless vector control system of AC induction motors (IMs) based on MRAS (Model Reference Adaptive System) mechanism is presented in this paper. The proposed system includes a rotor flux estimator and a speed estimator. By means of flux observing, the flux calculation's integration problems of the voltage model, such as the initial value and the drift of a pure integrator, are avoided. Both the stator-flux observer and speed estimator, based on the rotor field orientation control, can achieve perfect estimation in both steady-state operating condition as well as in transient operation. A simulation research is done for the speed-sensorless vector control system of IM under MATLAB/SIMULINK, and the simulation results show the good performance of the system in torque, speed and robustness. Also, a real system includes TI's DSP TMS320F2812 as central control unit is developed, series of experimental research is conducted and the results verify the scheme above is valid and the estimated speed tracks the actual speed well in both rated speed region and field weakening region.

Authors: M. Daoud; A. Elserougi; A. Massoud; R. Bojoi; S. Ahmed
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Qatar University, Doha, Qatar; Department of Electrical Engineering, Qatar University, Doha, Qatar; Department of Electrical Engineering, Qatar University, Doha, Qatar; Dipartimento Energia, Politecnico di Torino, Torino, Italy; Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Texas A&M University at Qatar
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Medium-Voltage Variable Speed Drives (VSDs) are the backbone of several critical industries. Providing the proper dc-link voltage to support the VSD's converter is crucial. Conventionally, dc-link voltage is supplied either by a two-level rectifier with series-connected Insulated Gate Bipolar Transistors (IGBTs) and front-end isolation transformer or by a 12-pulse uncontrolled rectifier with a complex phase shifting transformer. This work proposes a new approach using series-connected multi Half-Bridge (HB) modules to generate the required dc-link voltage. The proposed topology is able to perform the AC-DC power conversion by employing lower voltage rating switching devices. Moreover, the proposed control strategy yields well-regulated dc-link voltage and a negligible Total Harmonic Distortion (THD) of the input ac source current. A simulation for the proposed system is investigated using MATLAB/Simulink platform.

Abstract: LLC resonant converter is attractive for its high power density, high efficiency. When converter is operating below the resonant frequency, traditional FHA method is not accurate to obtain an adequate inductor to let system operate in zero-voltage-switching (ZVS) mode. This paper proposes a novel method to analyze the value of magnetic current from the perspective of energy conversion. During load switching, if the operating point moves to the capacitive region, the switch will lose ZVS. This paper propose a method to determine if the converter is likely to lose ZVS during load switching based on circuit parameters. Finally, a 300W 500kHz 400V/24V half-bridge LLC resonant converter is built to verify the validity of method.

Abstract: Recently, the importance of high efficiency power system is increasing due to environmental problems. As a result, the use of three-level converters with higher efficiency than conventional two-level converters is increasing. In this paper, the level change method for 3-level T-type PWM converter is proposed. In this paper, the level change method for 3-level T-type PWM converter is proposed. At low voltage, the conduction loss of the neutral switch of the T-type converter increases. Therefore, the 2-level operation loss may be smaller than 3-level operation. To improve the efficiency of the PWM converter, 2 and 3 levels are selectively operated depending on the estimated switching loss. The validity of the proposed method is verified by simulation.

Abstract: In order to improve the overload ability of permanent magnet (PM) torque motor, a PM torque motor made by oriented silicon steel sheets is proposed in this paper. The proposed motor is constructed with single tooth assembly structure, which make the rolling direction coincides with the radial direction and the cutting direction coincides with the peripheral direction. Because of the higher saturation magnetic density of the rolling direction, the proposed motor can present higher overload ability. The finite element software ANSOFT is employed to simulate the load torque, and the simulation results show the motor with oriented silicon steel sheets can provide higher torque with the same condition compared with the non-oriented ones. And then by adjusting the width of tooth, the narrower tooth width can make the overload ability advantage of oriented silicon steel sheets motor more obviously.

Abstract: This paper presents modeling and analysis of power device losses for induction cooker applications in which GaN-FET, SiC-FET, and Si-IGBT devices are used. Induction cookers have the merits of rapid heating, safety, cleanliness, and accurate temperature control. However, their power consumption is slightly high compared to other consumer appliances. Because improved power conversion efficiency is a crucial part of product popularity, it is necessary to use wide-band-gap devices like GaN-FET and SiC-FET. In this paper, power losses in three different power switching devices are compared and evaluated through theoretical analysis and simulation models in induction cooker applications. A PSIM thermal analysis model built is to demonstrate the validity of the analysis and modeling approach.

Author Affiliations: School of Electrical Engeneering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; School of Electrical Engeneering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; School of Electrical Engeneering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; School of Electrical Engeneering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A family of quasi-Z-source converters is proposed in this paper, which can be utilized in the photovoltaic modules and other applications demanding high voltage conversion. The converters retain the advantage of quasi-Z-source like common ground between the input and output as well as the superiorities of enhanced boost abilities and lower stresses. This paper presents the mathematical analysis of the converters and their performance comparison with other converters in detail. Finally, a 100W prototype is constructed and the experimental results are provided to verify the performance and feasibility.

Document Title: Experimental Study of a Radial Composite Ultrasonic Motor
Authors: C. Jiang; X. Dong; D. Lu; L. Zhou
Author Affiliations: Nanjing Institute of Technology, School of Electric Power Engineering, Nanjing, China; Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Nanjing Institute of Technology, School of Electric Power Engineering, Nanjing, China; Nanjing Institute of Technology, School of Electric Power Engineering, Nanjing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A radial composite ultrasonic motor is studied with experimental method in this paper. Firstly, the impedance-frequency characteristics of the stator under free condition and assembled condition are measured with impedance analyzer in order to investigate the impact of the preload force between the stator and rotor on the resonant frequency of the stator. Subsequently, the vibration mechanism of the stator is studied with laser Doppler vibrometer. The radial vibration amplitude of the stator under different voltages are measured and analyzed. Finally, Torque-speed curves of the ultrasonic motor under different voltages are measured and compared. The feasibility of the motor is verified by experimental results. The study in this paper provides a reference value for designing and optimizing the radial composite ultrasonic motor.
Author Keywords: ultrasonic motor;radial composite;impedance-frequency characteristics;radial vibration;torque-speed curves

Document Title: A Compact Two-Stage Power Converter for Flexible Multiple-Battery Charging
Authors: M. Li; J. He; B. Liang; J. Han
Author Affiliations: Tianjin University, China; Tianjin University, China; Tianjin University, China; Inner Mongolia Electric Power (Group) Co. Ltd, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, a modified converter topology is proposed to reduce battery charging system cost and enhance flexibility. The proposed system is interfaced to the grid with an H-bridge converter and the DC rails voltage is separated into upper and lower two parts by employing a de-voltage divider. Then, DC rails are connected to another isolated DC link through dual active bridge converters (DABs). In this proposed system, since the employment of voltage divider and the coordinated phase-shifting control of DAB converters, each DC links voltage can be regulated independently to meet with the battery control requirements without any noticeable interference. At the same time, the sinusoidal grid current is guaranteed in different cases. Simulated results are provided to validate the correctness of the proposed topology and corresponding control strategy.
Author Keywords: DC voltage regulation;Grid-interfacing converter;renewable energy
INSPEC Controlled Terms: bridge circuits;DC-DC power convertors;switching convertors;voltage control;voltage dividers

Document Title: The Demagnetizing Protection of Halbach Consequent Pole in a Magnetic-Geared Machine
Authors: H. Huang; L. Jing; R. Qu; D. Li
Author Affiliations: School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, 430074, China; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, 430074, China; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, 430074, China; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, 430074, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Halbach consequent pole (HCP) PM array has been applied in many PM machines recently for its unique features. For example, Halbach consequent pole can be directly embedded into the slot opening, it increases the back EMF and other performance of the stator-PM machines. However, due to the specific structure, tangential magnets in Halbach consequent pole has higher risk of demagnetization than regular magnet forms. To solve this problem, several demagnetizing protection methods are proposed and there effects are studied and discussed in this paper. As a result, a demagnetization optimized magnetic-geared machine with Halbach consequent pole in the slot opening is proposed and compared with the original design.
Author Keywords: Halbach;consequent pole;demagnetization;practical design;stator PM machine;magnetic-geared machine

Document Title: 3D Modeling and Simulation on Capacitive Interruption in High-Voltage Circuit Breakers
Authors: M. Cui; C. Y. Bae; J. Y. Park; J. S. Ryu; J. Choi; Y. G. Kim
Author Affiliations: LSIS, Republic of KOREA; LSIS, Republic of KOREA; LSIS, Republic of KOREA; LSIS, Republic of KOREA; LSIS, Republic of KOREA; LSIS, Republic of KOREA
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In a general case, due to the axisymmetry of a HVCB (high-voltage circuit breaker), the models for fluid dynamics simulation and electrostatics simulation are created on two-dimensional planar. However, in some particular cases, for instance 8 evenly distributed through-holes machined on the auxiliary nozzle, precise three-dimensional modeling is obligatory for obtaining a reliable analysis result. In this contribution a three-dimensional simulation method is presented, which consists of two parts: a 3D fluid dynamics simulation implemented by Ansys CFX and a 3D electrostatic analysis implemented by COMSOL Electrostatics. The difference between using a precise three-dimensional model and compromised two-dimensional models is also investigated by a time-resolved comparison of analysis result. This provides an available reference for modeling simplification in a similar situation. Finally, the analysis result is utilized by a sophisticated equation to evaluate the transient breakdown voltage for the capacitive current switching test. The capacitive interruption performance in turn can be estimated by comparing the transient breakdown voltage to the transient recovery voltage.
Author Keywords: 3D Modeling;capacitive current switching test;fluid dynamics;electrostatics;high-voltage circuit breakers
IEEE Terms: Solid modeling;Three-dimensional displays;Two dimensional displays;Pins;Simulation;Fluid dynamics
INSPEC Controlled Terms: circuit breakers;electric breakdown;fluid dynamics;nozzles;power engineering computing

Document Title: A Stable Start-Up Control Strategy for VSC-Based DC Microgrid
Authors: Q. Wan; J. Guo; J. Li
Author Affiliations: North China University of Technology, Beijing, China; North China University of Technology, Beijing, China; North China University of Technology, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: To minimize the over-current and over-voltage impact during start-up process of DC microgrid, a coordinated start-up strategy for multi-terminal DC microgrid is designed. For safety operation of the system, AC power grid and energy storage system (ESS) are both used as slack terminal, and a first order inner loop is adopted to achieve the smoothly startup of the system. In combination with the DC microgrid experimental platform, experiments are carried out to verify the effectiveness of the proposed method.

Document Title: A Novel Zero-Voltage- Transition Snubber Cell for Dual Buck Half Bridge Inverter
Authors: J. Wei; B. Kou; M. Wang
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, a novel zero-voltage transition (ZVT) snubber cell is developed for pulse width modulated (PWM) dual buck half bridge inverter (DBHBI) operating in current continuous conduction mode. The soft-switching condition can be realized within the full load range and main switches voltage and current stresses are within the allowable range. It simplifies the ZVT soft-switching topology by taking advantage of the characteristics of dual buck half bridge inverter. The characteristics of high reliability and low THD of dual buck half bridge inverter are remained in the proposed inverter at the same time. The ZVT soft-switching can transfer the stored energy effectively and ensure the auxiliary circuit in a state of soft-switching. Consequently, simulation result verifies these analyses and indicates that the switching losses can be reduced and the efficiency of the system can be improved remarkably.
Author Keywords: dual buck half bridge;reliability;zero-voltage-transition soft-switching;efficiency

Authors: C. Angerer; M. Felgenhauer; I. Eroglu; M. Zähringer; S. Kalt; M. Lienkamp

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The authors present a model that determines the dimensions, weight and costs of drive-units for electric vehicle powertrains. It represents electric motors and transmissions and is based on analytical design processes that calculate the component dimensions. The assignment of materials and manufacturing processes identifies the weight and the production costs. The main application of the model is powertrain design optimization where an automated determination of these properties is important. Finally, the authors present a model validation with data of existing components. It indicates a valid model behavior.

Document Title: Impedance Control of Self-Sensing Piezoelectric Actuator for Vibration Suppression
Authors: L. Chang; M. Tsai; K. Chen; Z. Lu
Author Affiliations: Department of Mechanical Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Tainan, Taiwan; Department of Mechanical Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Tainan, Taiwan; Department of Mechanical Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Tainan, Taiwan; Department of Mechanical Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Tainan, Taiwan
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper presents a vibration suppression method for a self-sensing piezoelectric actuator based on impedance control design. A velocity observer is proposed to estimate the vibration velocity by the measurement of driving voltage and current signals such that the active vibration suppression can be achieved by feedback control technique. Because the performance of vibration suppression is highly influenced by the mechanical impedance of the self-sensing system, the appropriate controller parameters should be designed from the mechanical impedance perspective. The experimental results are given to show that the proposed vibration suppression approach can effectively reduce the structural resonance phenomenon.

Document Title: Generalized Sequential Model Predictive Control of Induction Motor Drives
Authors: Y. Zhang; B. Zhang; H. Yang; M. Norambuena; J. Rodriauez
Author Affiliations: North China University of Technology, Inverter Technologies Engineering Research Center of Beijing, Beijing, China; North China University of Technology, Inverter Technologies Engineering Research Center of Beijing, Beijing, China; University of Technology Sydney, Sydney, Australia; Universidad Andres Bello, Santiago, Chile; Universidad Andres Bello, Santiago, Chile
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A very simple sequential model predictive control (SMPC) is recently proposed to achieve high performance control of induction motor (IM) drives. By evaluating two separate cost functions for torque and stator flux amplitude in a cascaded way, the weighting factor in conventional MPC is eliminated. However, SMPC cannot achieve stable operation over the full speed range. if the cost function for stator flux is firstly evaluated. This paper proposes a generalized SMPC which is effective when anyone of the two cost functions is firstly evaluated. This increases the stability and universality of conventional SMPC. The experimental results confirms the effectiveness of the proposed method.

Author Affiliations: Dept. of Digital Control Eng., Hoseo University, Asan, South Korea; Dept. of Information Control Eng., Hoseo University, Asan, South Korea; Dept. of Digital Control Eng., Hoseo University, Asan, South Korea; Dept. of Digital Control Eng., Hoseo University, Asan, South Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, a strict dynamic analysis for hysteresis motor is executed using a hysteresis motor equivalent circuit including eddy current and inverse Preisach model. For the permeability of the hysteresis ring, the hysteresis motor steady-state analysis including the inverse Preisach model is used. That is, it is possible to analyze the rotor characteristics according to the applied voltage. The Hysteresis loop is approximated to an ellipse loop for dynamic analysis. The variation of speed, torque, current etc. of the motor from starting to steady-state are calculated considering inertia, friction, and windage load. From these result, the load characteristics are analyzed.

Document Title: A Simple Commutation Torque Ripple Reduction Method of BLDC Motors Using a Hybrid PWM Compensation
Authors: S. Kim; J. Park; D. Lee
Author Affiliations: Dept. of Mechatronics Engineering Kyungsung University Busan, Korea; Dept. of Mechatronics Engineering Kyungsung University Busan, Korea; Dept. of Mechatronics Engineering Kyungsung University Busan, Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper presents an improved hybrid switching with voltage compensation function (VCF) to reduce torque ripple in commutating region and switching loss of a Brushless DC (BLDC) motor. In the proposed method, a modified 3-phase switching method is adopted to compensate the torque ripple in commutation region. Also, the conventional 2-phase switching method is used to reduce the switching loss during conduction. A simple VCF is designed to balance the slope of the outgoing and incoming phase currents during commutation. The designed VCF is added to the decreasing outgoing phase current to extend it during the built-up of the incoming phase current. Within a short commutation period, the proposed 3-phase switching method and VCF can reduce the commutation torque ripple. Total switching loss is dominantly determined by the conventional 2-phase switching method. The performance of the proposed control method is verified through experiment.
Author Keywords: BLDC Motor;Hybrid switching method;Commutation Torque ripple;Switching loss

Document Title: Design and Optimization of a Novel V-Type Consequent-Pole Interior Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motor for Applying to Refrigerant Compressor
Authors: M. Chiu; J. Chiang; C. Lin
Author Affiliations: NEW WIDETECH, Motor Design Dept., Tainan City, Taiwan; NEW WIDETECH, Motor Design Dept., Tainan City, Taiwan; NEW WIDETECH, Motor Design Dept., Tainan City, Taiwan
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A novel V-type consequent-pole interior permanent-magnet synchronous motor (V-type CP-IPMSM) was proposed in this study. The air-gap flux density, back EMF, cogging torque, iron losses, and efficiency were evaluated, and the corresponding geometrical arrangement of the rotor is optimized to meet the specific load demand based on a Multi-objective Taguchi (MOT) method to lower the magnetic material usage whereas the operational magnetic fluxes are maintained. The results showed that our proposed low-cost and high-performance V-type CP-IPMSM can satisfy the objective load demand with a 33.9% reduction in magnet usage and is thus very competitive for inverter-based air-conditioning refrigerant compressor applications.

Document Title: Characteristics Analysis of a Novel 12/14 Conical Bearingless Switched Reluctance Motor
Authors: Z. Xu; J. Liu
Author Affiliations: Chinese Academy of Sciences, State Key Laboratory of Robotics Shenyang Institute of Automation, Shenyang, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, State Key Laboratory of Robotics Shenyang Institute of Automation, Shenyang, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In order to realize the active control of five-Degrees of Freedom (5-DOF) of the rotation part, a novel conical bearingless switched reluctance motor (BLSRM) is proposed in this paper. Unlike conventional BLSRMs, the proposed structure is composed of two conical 12/14 BLSRMs, and each conical type adopts hybrid stator poles with short flux paths. Therefore, the proposed structure has naturally decoupled characteristics between the torque and suspending force, which may reduce the control difficulty of the BLSRM. In addition, the proposed structure could control the radial and axial positions of the rotor simultaneously due to the conical structure, thereby completely realizing the self-suspension of the rotor. To verify the proposed structure, finite element method (FEM) is employed to get the characteristics of the proposed structure. Finally, the validity of the proposed structure is verified by the analysis results.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, an improved speed synchronization control algorithm based on cross coupling is proposed for dual servo motors control. This method controls two motors synchronously from the angle of bandwidth and solves the problem of controlling the coupling of the target in the traditional speed cross coupling control algorithm. It has a clear control target and can realize the speed synchronization of the two motors more effectively. In this paper, a series of simulation results are given to verify the effectiveness of the improved speed control algorithm based on cross coupling.

Document Title: Design and Performance Comparison of Novel Single-Phase Hybrid Switched Reluctance Motors
Authors: K. Jeong; G. F. Lukman; J. Ahn
Author Affiliations: Dept. of Mechatronics Eng., Kyungsung University, Korea; Dept. of Mechatronics Eng., Kyungsung University, Korea; Dept. of Mechatronics Eng., Kyungsung University, Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper presents the design and performance comparison of novel single-phase hybrid switched reluctance motors (HSRM) to replace universal motor. The motors are easy to manufacture due to their simple yet robust structures with minimized power switches and no torque dead-zone. The stators have permanent magnets (PMs) mounted on the inner surface and the three rotor structures are adopted: stepper type with a wide pole arc, non-uniform surface type, and partly salient type which contribute to the elimination of torque dead-zone. PMs are placed at parking position for self-start and to create positive cogging torque in the torque dead-zone. To verify effectiveness, finite element method (FEM) is employed to analyze the performance of the proposed structures. Prototype motors were manufactured and tested. The experimental results are presented to compare each motor's performance.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Electric drives need approximately 65% of the electricity consumed by the European industry to drive pumps, fans, compressors and so on [1]. The classic induction motor has been the workhorse of the industry for decades. However, this type of motor has significant losses in efficiency, especially in the low power range considered here. Consequently, the increase of energy efficiency of electric machines is a main point in the worldwide efforts to reduce CO2 emissions. However, the cost of new efficient technologies are still a main selling point. This paper presents an impressively simple energy-and resource saving as well as low cost design for synchronous reluctance machines in the low power range.

Document Title: Analysis and Design of High Voltage Resonant Converter Operating in Discontinuous Current Mode
Authors: Z. Chen; J. Liu; S. Fan; C. Tong
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, North China University of Technology, Beijing, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, North China University of Technology, Beijing, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, North China University of Technology, Beijing, China; Department of Automation, University of Science and Technology Beijing, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In order to illustrate the resonant process of the LCC resonant converter in discontinuous current mode (DCM) and simplify its design the time domain model of the converter is derived, and a new approach to resonant parameter design is proposed in this paper. The approach reveals the relationship between the resonant parameters and the characteristic parameters of the circuit. First, the resonant process of the resonant converter in DCM has been studied and the mathematical model of the converter in time domain is derived accordingly. Based on this model, the circuit characteristics of the converter are analyzed. Then, the parameters design is proposed, considering the relationship between the ratio of capacitance in series and parallel versus voltage gain and resonant parameters. Simulation using Cadence and experimental verification has been completed with a 7kV12kW prototype.

Document Title: Design Optimization of Frction Disc-Based Electromagnetic Brakes for Higher Braking Torque
Authors: B. Chen; J. Wu; M. Shen; Q. Sun
Author Affiliations: Zhejiang University, College of Electrical Engineering, Hangzhou, China; Zhejiang University, College of Electrical Engineering, Hangzhou, China; Department of Motor Research, Zhejiang Founder Motor Co., Ltd., Lishui, China; Zhejiang University, College of Electrical Engineering, Hangzhou, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposes an optimization scheme for friction disc-based electromagnetic (EM) brakes, which can achieve higher braking torque at constant volume by maximizing the magnetic circuit utilization. Firstly, the magnetic equivalent circuit is calculated, then the initial dimensions are designed for the EM brakes according to the torque requirement. Secondly, the EM field results are analyzed in the two-dimensional (2-D) and three-dimensional (3-D) finite element method (FEM) environment, respectively. Thirdly, to generate higher braking torque for the EM brakes, the area ratio of inner suction annulus and the outer suction annulus is optimized to make full use of the magnetic circuit characteristics. In order to validate the effectiveness of the proposed braking torque increasing scheme, FEA simulations are carried out in ANSYS/Maxwell.

Abstract: The main objective of a condition monitoring programs is to track the health status of critical components of a machine. The proposed method is based on a feature learning from deep autoencoders and data fusion. The features can be learned by autoencoders using individual current and vibration signals, and then learning features are fused to make final health indicators. Abstract: This paper studies the mutual inductance between a pair of coaxial solenoid coils for wireless power transfer applied in implantable devices. This inductively coupled solenoid coil system, compared with the traditional antenna system, has an iron core introduced in the receiving coil for enhancing the inductive magnetic flux linking the coil. It allows transferring the power in the kHz range rather than the MHz range which normally requires a pure air core receiving coil, and hence it is a safer solution to human body. A simple analytical method for calculation of the mutual inductance as the key parameter in the wireless power transfer system is presented in this paper. Authors: J. Kim; G. Baek; T. K. Ko; Z. Zhang; S. Lee
Author Affiliations: School of Electrica land Electronic Engineering, Yonsei University, Seoul, Korea; School of Electrica land Electronic Engineering, Yonsei University, Seoul, Korea; School of Electrica land Electronic Engineering, Yonsei University, Seoul, Korea; College of Electrical Engineering and New Energy, China Three Gorges University, Hubei, China; Division of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Uiduk University, Gyeongsangbuk-do, Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Accelerators have been constantly developed widely used in a variety of applications for particle physics, material science, medicine, etc. The accelerator system has several magnets for control the particle trajectory. Among them, a quadruple magnet is employed to focus the accelerated particle beam. In conventionally, the quadruple magnet was made of low temperature superconductors (LTS) and iron carved for specific shape. However, that magnet has a nonlinear magnetic field characteristic with respect to the operating current due to the hysteresis characteristic of the iron core. For this reason, gradient, uniformity and effective length, indicating the performance of a quadruple magnet, are nonlinearly changed with respect to the operating current. Therefore, in order to improve such nonlinear characteristic, we eliminate the iron yoke for design an air-core LTS quadruple magnet. Therefore, we will show the design method and results of the air-core LTS quadruple magnet, and the magnetic field characteristics of air-core magnet will be compared with those of previously designed iron-core quadrupole.

Abstract: In order to obtain the better performance, the parameters optimization of the hybrid excitation permanent magnet synchronous motor(HEPMSM) need to be performed. Abstract: In recent years, the number of battery electric vehicles and hybrid electric vehicles has risen. In this context, the importance of 48 V-systems has increased as they are becoming more widely used in both vehicle concepts. Thus, they are given more attention in research and development. This paper introduces an example of an electric drive train in a battery electric vehicle. This drivetrain was implemented in the context of the aCar mobility project which aims to provide mobility for developing countries, especially in Africa. The requirements of the target region led to the design of a robust electric vehicle with all-wheel-drive, which utilizes electrical machines designed for mild-hybrid applications. This paper explains why a 48 V- system is suitable for this application and offers advantages when compared to a high-voltage drivetrain. During prototype testing in Ghana, it was demonstrated that the drivetrain is suitable for the typical road and weather conditions of Sub-Saharan Africa.

Abstract: Apart from the stator slot permeance, interior permanent magnet synchronous motor (IPMSM) has a rotor permeance which varies depending on the rotor angle. Authors: Z. Ye; X. Wang
Author Affiliations: Tsinghua University, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, P.R.C; Tsinghua University, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, P.R.C
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A behavioral model of SiC MOSFET on hard-switching condition is proposed. The model is based on double pulse test (DPT), in which the SiC MOSFET is combined with a SiC Schottky Barrier Diode (SBD). The nonlinearity of the junction capacitance and parasitic elements in the circuit are considered. To reduce the complexity of commonly proposed models, the model develops average value equations rather than differential equations to describe the circuit and estimate the switching time. The results of calculation and experiments are compared with previously proposed model, which shows that the model can provide a simple prediction of SiC MOSFET hard-switching characteristics.

Document Title: Research on Temperature-Dependent Overcurrent Protection Schemes for SiC MOSFETs
Authors: Z. Wang; C. Tong; Y. Zhang
Author Affiliations: University of Science and Technology, School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Beijing; University of Science and Technology, School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Beijing; North China University of Technology, Inverter Technologies Engineering Research Center of Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The maximum continuous drain current of SiC MOSFETs varies with the junction temperature, which is closely related to load and ambient temperature. The traditional constant threshold overcurrent protection based on hardware or software cannot adjust the protection threshold according to the junction temperature, resulting in the failure of protection. The relationships among the on-state resistance, the maximum current, the maximum power loss, the junction temperature and the case temperature are analyzed first and then a novel temperature-dependent overcurrent protection scheme is proposed in this paper, which is based on the case temperature of SiC MOSFETs. The threshold of overcurrent protection can be adjusted in real time and it enables the maximum current operation of SiC MOSFETs, which means the utilization rate of power devices is enhanced. The proposed schemes is applied on a single-phase inverter and the experiments show that the scheme can effectively widen the safe operation area of SiC MOSFETs.

Abstract: This paper deals with the cogging torque reduction in surface-mounted permanent magnet synchronous motors with overhang by considering the step-skewed rotor method. Firstly, optimal step-skew angle of the rotor is determined not only to minimize cogging torque but also to meet the required output torque. Furthermore, each rotor stack length should be appropriately adjusted to reduce the cogging torque more effectively in the way to make the axial directional flux density distribution on each stack uniformly. The analysis reveals that the proposed step-skew method is useful in minimizing cogging torque, and the experiment results show the validity of the cogging torque reduction model selected by analytical results.

Document Title: Design Considerations of Auxiliary Power Supply Unit with SiC MOSFET for Lightweight Railway Vehicles
Authors: I. Lee; J. Kang; J. Lee; S. Lee
Author Affiliations: Dept Electrical Engineering, Hanyang University, Korea; Dept Electrical Engineering, Hanyang University, Korea; Dept. Mechatronics Engineering, Hanyang University, Korea; Automotive Electronics Research Center, Korea Electronics Technology Institute, Korea
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Railway vehicles are widely used worldwide. The weight reduction of railway vehicles can contribute to environmental friendliness by reducing energy and emissions. Hence, the investigations thereof are actively pursued. We herein propose to reduce the weight of the auxiliary power supply unit. The inverter of the auxiliary power source has been designed based on a Si IGBT. Si IGBTs are widely used in high-power applications. However, because Si IGBTs exhibit a low switching frequency and a relatively large switching loss, a large heat dissipation design is required. Therefore, a limitation in weight reduction exists. Meanwhile, SiC MOSFETs can drive a high switching frequency at a high power, and reduce heat dissipation due to low loss. Therefore, the SiC MOSFETs are validated through loss comparison and thermal analysis simulation. Additionally, the bus plate for minimizing stray inductance in the inverter drive was fabricated using various methods.

Abstract: When designing a power electronics apparatus such as rectifiers and inverters, it is indispensable to calculate the power loss of power semiconductors for estimation of power conversion efficiency, which influences circuit mounting and cooling design of the apparatus. In this paper, a new approach to power loss calculation of power semiconductors based on Impulse Model is proposed. The approach is achieved by MATLAB-Simulink, and then the precision of the method is estimated by comparing with a conventional loss calculation way. Abstract: This research paper presents a modified half-bridge dc-dc converter for applying with high input voltage applications. Abstract: In this paper, a pole-piece shape is proposed. We want to improve the low torque characteristics of the magnet gear and the large torque ripple problem. The relationship between the design variables and the objective function was analyzed using the Box-behnken method. Therefore the proposed pole-piece design increases the output density of the magnet gear and reduces the torque ripple which affects noise and vibration during gear operation. We also compared the transmission torque characteristics of general pole-piece, conventional magnetic flux concentrating type pole -piece, pole-piece of optimal design. Abstract: There are many proven advantages of microgrid deployment, such as energy cost saving, resiliency, and reduced carbon emission. However, microgrids are relatively new, complex, and require high initial investment costs. For this reason, risks associated with the investment should be thoroughly accessed during the planning process. In this paper, we investigate the impacts of policy and technology risk on microgrid investment. In particular, we examine the effect of changing incentives policies and technology performance assumptions. We used MDSTool to design a grid-connected microgrid for three different types of commercial buildings assumed to be located in the state of California. Our results show that policy and technology risks can have a big impact on the net present value of the investment.

Abstract: Magnetic gears have attracted a lot of interest in various applications since they can transmit torque without mechanical contact. In this paper transient-operation properties of a harmonic magnetic reducer model based on the Atallah's model are analyzed with the finite element method. Abstract: An analytical calculation model of an induction machine with squirrel cage rotors considering the influence of leakage path saturation is presented. The model bases on the harmonic field theory and takes into account multiple armature reaction and slot openings. Therefore, it is capable to calculate several parasitic effects. The harmonic field theory is only truly valid for ideal material characteristics. Here, it is shown that next to considering the saturation of the fundamental wave also the saturation of leakage paths can be incorporated in the theory and it is still possible to calculate parasitic effects accurately.

Abstract: This paper presents a subspace-based approach to identify and extract harmonics of interest for the diagnosis of stator and rotor related faults in induction machines. Document Title: Investigation of Phase Angle Displacements in Six-Phase PMSM with Concentrated Windings for Reduced MMF Harmonics
Authors: H. Dhulipati; S. Mukundan; W. Li; J. Tjong; N. C. Kar
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Windsor, Windsor, Canada; Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Windsor, Windsor, Canada; Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Windsor, Windsor, Canada; Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Windsor, Windsor, Canada; Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Windsor, Windsor, Canada
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Multiphase concentrated wound (CW) permanent magnet synchronous machines (PMSMs) have high content of space harmonics in the magneto-motive force (MMF) waveforms. These harmonics result in distorted voltage waveforms and cause additional losses thereby deteriorating the machine's performance. However, the magnitude of space harmonics in multi-phase machines is lesser when compared to three-phase CW PMSM. In order to eliminate and/or reduce space harmonics even further in the MMF waveforms, this paper investigates non-conventional phase angle displacements for a six-phase 36-slot/34-pole CW PMSM. The six-phase CW PMSM considered has two independent three-phase windings. Conventional six-phase CW PMSM have phase angle displacements of 60° (symmetrical configuration) or 30° (asymmetrical configuration) between the two-phase sets. Based on star of slots method, a number of possible phase shifts between the two sets of three phase windings are investigated for reduced MMF harmonics, improved demagnetization and other performance characteristics for the 36-slot/34-pole PMSM and are compared along with conventional phase displacement angles of 60° and 30°.
Author Keywords: Concentrated windings;Dual three-phase;Magneto-motive force harmonics;Permanent magnet synchronous machine;Phase angle displacement

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The Micro-Electro-Mechanical System (MEMS) gyroscope provides the feedback information of servo close loop control, because it is taken as platform attitude sensor. Thus it has an important influence on the stable platform performance. Aimed at the problem that the stable platform has the poor performance under the high impact force condition, the MEMS gyroscope output signal feature is analyzed. Based on the MEMS gyroscope working principle analysis, the corresponding dynamic equation under the high impact force condition is constructed by the way of mass-spring-damping system. By solved the above dynamic equation, the analytic solution of MEMS gyroscope output under the high impact condition can be gained. Based on the mechanical features of the MEMS gyroscope, the analytic solution feature is analyzed. The analysis result shows that the output of MEMS gyroscope deviates from the real value under the high impact force condition. Thus, it cannot be used as the feedback information of servo close loop control.

Abstract: The output side of inverters connected with a transformer is an inevitable and severe work condition. This paper studies a novel cycle-by-cycle (CBC) current limiting technology for Neutral Point Clamped (NPC) Three-level (TL) Half-bridge inverter connected with a transformer. This current limiting technology can protect the inverter from the surge magnetizing current of the transformer at the time of the output relay turned ON. Abstract: Metal detector is widely used in food security and industrial manufacture. Authors: H. Wen; M. Cheng; Y. Jiang

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, the operating principle and electromagnetic performances of the direct current machine (DCM) are reiterated from a new perspective, viz., the airgap field modulation perspective. The equivalent airgap model containing three cascaded elements is applied, based on the general airgap field modulation theory (GAFMT), to expound the operating principle and common features of the four most conventional topologies in a unified way. The general analysis of DCM can be achieved existing in the only difference of modulation behavior, that is modulator like that in induction machine (IM) and synchronous machine (SM), whose results are consistent with the classical theory on electrical machines. Theoretical expressions for electromagnetic parameters are developed and fairly compared between different topologies to verify the validity of the proposed analytical model. In addition, torque density comparison under different constraints are revealed and iron saturation has been treated as a constant discount on the airgap magnetomotive force (MMF) due to the synchronous modulation mechanism. The theoretical predictions are demonstrated by 2D finite element analysis (FEA) and achieve good agreement.

Abstract: Mobile sensor nodes (MSNs) are widely used in industrial applications to perform sensing in area where the deployment of static sensor nodes are not feasible. MSN uses localization technique to continuously track the location of MSNs, so that the desired sensing area can be fully covered. This paper presents an automated position recalibration technique to eliminate drift error from MSN's dead reckoning. The proposed recalibration process uses QR code and image processing technique to reposition the MSN accurately from time to time. In addition to that, the proposed localization system comes with command dispatch, MSNs' positions and trajectories visualization capabilities via cloud computing. The proposed solution is suitable for environmental monitoring in indoor environment such as industrial warehouse, factory and office.

Document Title: Sequence Impedance Modeling and Stability Analysis of Single-Phase Converters
Authors: H. Zhang; Z. Liu; S. Wu
Author Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, P.R. China; School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, P.R. China; School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, P.R. China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The utilization of a large number of power electronic converters in power systems results in many kinds of stability problems, such as low-frequency oscillations and harmonic instability and so on. The impedance-based stability analysis method can be employed to effectively study the stability of converter systems, so it is important to establish the precise impedance model for stability analysis. Firstly, based on the application of single-phase converters in high-speed railway electric multiple units, a sequence impedance model based on harmonic linearization is established. Secondly, an approach of impedance measurement method based on the frequency-scanning method and impedance calculation method considering of positive and negative frequency signals are presented. The input impedance is respectively measured by Simulink offline simulations and experiments of hardware in the loop base on the frequency-scanning method and is compared with theoretical modeling impedance. The results prove the accuracy of sequence impedance modeling based on harmonic linearization. Finally, the stability of the simplified vehicle-grid coupling system is verified by generalized Nyquist stability criterion.

Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Due to the high loss density and thermal dissipation difficulty of high speed permanent magnet synchronous motor (HSPMSM), permanent magnet is prone to irreversible demagnetization at high temperature. Furthermore, overheating of the rotor will lead to the decrease of the strength and stiffness of shaft, elongation of shaft, etc, affecting the bearings suspension accuracy and stability, especially for the motor with magnetic bearings. To solve these problems, an improved radial and axial hybrid cooling system, greatly simplifying the ventilation cooling structure, is presented for a 70kW, 30000 rpm HSPMSM with magnetic bearings in this paper. The fluid field and temperature field calculation model are established by finite element software, and the fluid flow distribution in cooling system and the temperature distribution of the motor are both analyzed in detail. Finally, experiments with the prototype show that the improved hybrid cooling system has excellent cooling effect, and also show that the motor with rated speed can run stably for a long time under no-load and load conditions, whose efficiency is over 97%.

Abstract: Pitch systems are among the wind turbine components with most frequent failures. This article presents a multicomponent fault detection for induction motors and planetary gearboxes of the electric pitch drives using only the three-phase motor line currents. A deep autoencoder is used to extract features from the extended Park's vector modulus of the motor three-phase currents and a support vector machine to classify faults. The methodology is validated in a laboratory setup of a scaled pitch drive, with four commonly occurring faults, namely, the motor stator turns fault, broken rotor bars fault, planetary gearbox bearing fault and planet gear faults, under varying load and speed conditions.

Abstract: This paper presents a capacity optimization method for the filter inductance and dc-link capacitance of three-phase voltage-source PWM converter (VSCs) with pulse power loads (PPLs). The impact of the PPLs on the VSCs was firstly investigated. In order to restrain the oscillations and distortion of the dc-bus voltage caused by the PPLs, the capacity of the filter inductance and dc-link capacitance should be carefully designed. It was found that a bigger capacity setup could obtain a smoother operation condition, but the size and weight of the whole VSCs might exceed the limit, especially in the more/all electric aircraft system. To get a preferable value, a general capacity evaluation method of the filter inductance and dc-link capacitance of the VSCs was then proposed, considering the voltage stability of the converter and the influence of the PPLs as well. Simulation studies were finally carried out to verify the effectiveness of the proposed method.

Authors: X. Zhang; C. Zhang; P. Fu; C. Zhang; L. Li
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, a novel cooling technique for the windings of high-torque-density permanent magnet machines is presented, that is, a miniature heat pipe inserting into the slot is adopted, thus, transferring the heat of the winding to the ambient air axially and increasing the convective area by fins. To describe the thermal performance accurately, a heat pipe with outer diameter of 2mm is tested and its thermal model is obtained according to the test result. To investigate the validity of the proposed technique, a lumped parameter transient thermal network (TN) model of the stator with heat pipes is established. The thermal performance of a 167W machine whose torque density is 5N·m/kg with this cooling technique is studied by using the thermal network. The analytical results show that the winding temperature is not more than 100°C when the current density is up to 12.5A/mm<sup>2</sup> with 4m/s forced air cooling. A finite element analysis (FEA) model is built and simulated to verify the analytical results.

Abstract: This paper is concerned with flux and voltage vector-oriented control schemes for direct voltage control (DVC) of the stand-alone brushless doubly-fed induction generator (BDFIG) for ship shaft power generation applications. The proposed control schemes are carried out based on a simple robust phase-locked loop (PLL) method to effectively estimate the correct position for the intended orientation purpose. Authors: C. Hittinger; I. Hahn
Author Affiliations: Friedrich-Alexander- University Erlangen-Nürnberg, Institute of Electrical Drives and Machines, Erlangen, Germany; Friedrich-Alexander- University Erlangen-Nürnberg, Institute of Electrical Drives and Machines, Erlangen, Germany
Publication Title: 2018 21st International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: For sensorless position estimation at low speed and standstill, methods using signal injection are commonly used. These methods need an electromagnetic saliency as a prerequisite. It can be described by the differential resistance or inductance, determined by evaluating the test signal current and voltage. In this work, a new method will be presented, that uses a weighted combination of the differential quantities for improving the accuracy of self-sensing position estimation over the whole operating area, especially at critical points. This method will be evaluated on a concept with short-circuited rotor windings, applied on a PMSM, for improving the electromagnetic saliency of the machine. The improvements due to the weighted combination of the differential quantities will be verified by measurement results on an experimental setup. The concept can be applied on every sensorless control scheme that exploits the voltage transfer function of the electric machine.
